translated: If, Blessed One, when I have attained awakening, the bodhisattvas in that buddha-field were to generate this thought: 'If we remain right here in this world-system, we will honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in innumerable, incalculable buddha-fields, with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicines for the sick; with flowers, incense, lamps, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, banners, and flags; and with various kinds of dance, song, and music,'

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhā bhagavantaḥ sahacittotpādānna pratigṛhṇīyuryadidamanukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ saha citta utpādān na pratigṛhṇīyuḥ yat idam anukampām upādāya
translated: and if those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, were not to accept that out of compassion,

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: then may I not attain unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre ye bodhisattvāḥ pratyājātā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: saced me bhagavan bodhi prāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre ye bodhisattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: If, Blessed One, when I have attained awakening, the bodhisattvas who are reborn in that buddha-field

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre yaḥ kaścitsattvo'laṃkārasya varṇaparyantamudgṛhṇīyātantaśo divyenāpi cakṣuṣā evaṃvarṇamevaṃvibhūti idaṃ buddhakṣetramiti nānāvarṇatāṃ jānīyāt /
analyzed: saced me bhagavan bodhi prāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre yaḥ kaścid sattvaḥ ulaṃkārasya varṇa paryantam udgṛhṇīyāt atantaśas divyena api cakṣuṣā evaṃvarṇam evaṃvibhūti idam buddhakṣetram iti nānā varṇa tām jānīyāt

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: may I not attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre yaḥ sarvaparīttakuśalamūlo bodhisattvaḥ so'ntaśo yojanaśatotthitamudāravarṇaṃ bodhivṛkṣaṃ na saṃjānīyāt /

translated: Blessed One, if, when I have attained awakening, in that buddhafield, any bodhisattva with even the smallest wholesome roots would not perceive the bodhi tree rising up for even a hundred leagues with magnificent colors,

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: may I not attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre kasyacitsattvasyoddeśo vā svādhyāyo vā kartavyaḥ syāt /

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam  saced me bhagavan bodhi prāptasya na evam prabhāsvaram tat buddhakṣetram bhavet yatra samantāt aprameya asaṃkhyeya acintya atulya aparimāṇāni buddhakṣetrāṇi saṃdṛśyeran tat yathā api nāma parimṛṣṭe ādarśa maṇḍale mukha maṇḍalam  mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre dharaṇītalamupādāya yāvadantarīkṣāddevamanuṣyaviṣayātikrāntasyābhijātasya dhūpasya tathāgatabodhisattvapūjāpratyarhasya sarvaratnamayāni nānāsurabhigandhaghaṭikāśatasahasrāṇi sadā nidhūpitānyava na syuḥ /🔽mā tāvadahamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyam //
analyzed: saced me bhagavan bodhi prāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre dharaṇī talam upādāya yāvat antarīkṣāt deva manuṣya viṣaya atikrāntasya abhijātasya dhūpasya tathāgata bodhisattva pūjā pratyarhasya sarva ratna mayāni nānā surabhi gandha ghaṭikā śata sahasrāṇi sadā nidhūpitāni ava na syuḥ 🔽mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: May I not attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening if, Blessed One, after I attain awakening, in that buddhafield, from the surface of the earth up to the sky, there are not always burning incense burners made of various precious substances, surpassing the human and divine realms, of the highest quality, worthy of being offered to the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas, such as hundreds of thousands of incense burners made of various precious substances.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre na sadābhipravṛṣṭānyeva sugandhinānāratnapuṣpavarṣāṇi sadā pravāditāśca manojñasvarā vādyameghā na syuḥ /

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: then may I not attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya ye sattvā aprameyāsaṃkhyeyācinyātulyeṣu lokadhātuṣvābhayā sphuṭā bhaveyuḥ /

translated: If, Blessed One, when I have attained enlightenment, those beings who are illuminated by light from immeasurable, incalculable, inconceivable buddha-fields,

analyzed: saced me bhagavan bodhi prāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre saha utpannāḥ sattvāḥ na evaṃvidham sukham pratilabheran tat yathā api nāma niṣparidāhasya arhataḥ

translated: then may I not attain unsurpassed Complete Awakening.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tadanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ye bodhisattvā mama nāmadheyaṃ śrutvā tacchravaṇakuśalamūlena yāvadbodhiparyantaṃ te sarve bodhisattvacaryāprītiprāmodyakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā na bhaveyuḥ /

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam

analyzed: mā tāvat aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam

translated: May I not attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sacenme bhagavan bodhiprāptasya tatra buddhakṣetre tadanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ye ca bodhisattvā mama nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /

translated: If, Blessed One, when I have attained enlightenment, the bodhisattvas in other buddha-fields who hear my name,

analyzed: na jātu kāma vyāpāda vihiṃsā saṃjñām utpāditavān

analyzed: na jātu rūpa śabda gandha rasa spraṣṭavya saṃjñām utpāditavān

translated: He was a good companion in lovemaking, delightful to the mind, suitable for living with, handsome, well-nourished, with few desires, content, secluded, free from hatred, delusion, doubt, crookedness, deceit, and guile, with soft body hair, pleasant speech, always devoted, with his burden well placed in seeking the virtuous Dharma, and had made a great vow for the sake of all beings. He had great respect for the Buddha, Dharma, Saṅgha, teachers, preceptors, and spiritual friends, was always ready, straightforward, gentle, not deceitful, not flattering, virtuous, and took the lead in encouraging the adoption of all virtuous qualities. He was free from pride through abiding in emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-composition, and non-arising, and his speech was well guarded.🔽While practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, he abandoned whatever verbal action would lead to harm for himself, others, or both.

analyzed: tathāvidham tyaktvā yat vāc karma sva para ubhaya hita sukha saṃvartakam tat eva abhiprayuktavān
translated: He engaged only in verbal actions that would lead to benefit and happiness for himself, others, and both.

analyzed: evam ca yat grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu avataran na jātu rūpa śabda gandha rasa spraṣṭavya dharmeṣu anunītaḥ bhūt a pratihataḥ
translated: And thus he was fully aware, when entering villages, towns, markets, countries, states, and royal cities, he was never attracted or obstructed by forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, or mental objects.

translated: Practicing the bodhisattva conduct, he himself practiced the perfection of generosity and encouraged others to do the same.

analyzed: svayam ca śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñāpāramitāsu acarat
translated: He himself practiced morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom,

analyzed: parān ca tatra eva samādāpitavān

analyzed: tathārūpāṇi ca kuśala mūlāni samudānītavān

translated: For that long, immeasurable and countless Buddhas, Blessed Ones, have been honored, revered, respected, and worshipped with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for sickness, and requisites, with all the objects of desire, and with pleasant dwellings.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ sattvāḥ śreṣṭhi gṛhapati amātya kṣatriya brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kuleṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: As many beings as have been established in the positions of guild masters, leading merchants, ministers, nobles, brahmins, and wealthy householders,

analyzed: teṣām na sukaraḥ vāc karma nirdeśena paryantaḥ adhigantum
translated: it is not easy to reach the end of that by describing it with words.

original: evaṃ jāmbūdvīpeśvarāśca pratiṣṭhāpitāścakravartitve lokapālatve śakratve suyāmatve sutuṣitatve sunirmitatve suvaśavartitve devarājatve mahābrahmatve ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /

translated: Similarly, they have been established as lords of Jambudvīpa, universal monarchs, world guardians, Śakra, Suyāma, Sunirmāṇa, Suvaśa, kings of the gods, and great Brahmās.

original: tāvadaprameyāsaṃkhyeyā buddhā bhagavantaḥ satkṛtā gurukṛtā mānitāḥ pūjitāścīvarapiṇḍapātraśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sarvasukhopadhānasparśavihāraiḥ pratipāditāḥ /

translated: For that long, immeasurable and countless Buddhas, Blessed Ones, have been honored, revered, respected, and worshipped with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for sickness and requisites, with all the objects of desire, and with pleasant dwellings.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ sattvāḥ śreṣṭhi gṛhapati amātya kṣatriya brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kuleṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: As many beings as were established in the positions of guild masters, leading merchants, ministers, kṣatriyas, brahmins, and wealthy householders,

analyzed: teṣām na sukaraḥ vāc karma nirdeśena paryantaḥ adhigantum
translated: it is not easy to reach the end of describing their verbal actions.

original: evaṃ jāmbūdvīpeśvarāśca pratiṣṭhāpitāścakravartitve lokapālatve śakratve suyāmatve sutuṣitatve sunirmitatve vaśavartitve devarājatve mahābrahmatve ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam jāmbūdvīpa īśvarāḥ ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ cakravarti tve lokapāla tve śakra tve suyāma tve sutuṣita tve sunirmita tve vaśavarti tve devarāja tve mahābrahma tve ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: In the same way, they were established as lords of Jambudvīpa, universal monarchs, world guardians, Śakra, Suyāma, Sunirmāṇa, Vaśavartin, devarājas, and Mahābrahmās.

original: tāvadaprameyāsaṃkhyeyā buddhā bhagavantaḥ satkṛtā gurukṛtā mānitāḥ pūjitā dharmacakrapravartanārthaṃ cādhīṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: tāvat aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ satkṛtāḥ gurukṛtāḥ mānitāḥ pūjitāḥ dharma cakra pravartana artham ca adhīṣṭāḥ
translated: Thus, immeasurable, countless, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and inexpressible hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas of Buddhas, Blessed Ones, were honored, revered, respected, and worshipped, and requested to turn the wheel of Dharma.

analyzed: yeṣām na sukaraḥ vāc karma nirdeśena paryantaḥ adhigantum
translated: It is not easy to reach the end of describing their verbal actions.

analyzed: saḥ evaṃrūpam kuśalam samudānayat
translated: He accumulated such wholesome actions.

original: yadasya bodhisattvacaryāṃ carato'prameyāsaṃkhyeyācintyātulyāmāpyāparimāṇānabhilāpyāni kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi surabhirdivyātikrāntacandanagandho mukhātpravāti sma /
analyzed: yat asya bodhisattva caryām carataḥ uprameya asaṃkhyeya acintya atulya amāpya aparimāṇa anabhilāpyāni kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi surabhiḥ divya atikrānta candana gandhaḥ mukhāt pravāti sma
translated: While he was practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, for immeasurable, countless, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and inexpressible hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas, a fragrant scent surpassing divine sandalwood wafted from his mouth.

analyzed: sarva romakūpebhyaḥ utpala gandhaḥ vāti sma
translated: The fragrance of lotuses emanated from all his pores.

analyzed: sarva loka abhirūpaḥ ca abhūt prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ parama śubha varṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgataḥ lakṣaṇa vyañjana samalaṃkṛtena ātmabhāvena
translated: He became the most handsome in all the worlds, pleasing to the eye, endowed with the most excellent and pure complexion, with a body adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: tasya sarvaratnālakārāḥ sarvavastracīvarābhinirhārāḥ sarvapuṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacchatradhvajapatākābhinirhārāḥ sarvavādyasaṃgītyabhinirhārāśca sarvaromakūpebhyaḥ pāṇitalābhyāṃ ca niścaranti sma /
analyzed: tasya sarva ratna alakārāḥ sarva vastra cīvara abhinirhārāḥ sarva puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana chatra dhvaja patākā abhinirhārāḥ sarva vādya saṃgīti abhinirhārāḥ ca sarva romakūpebhyaḥ pāṇi talābhyām ca niścaranti sma
translated: All his ornaments of jewels, all his garments and robes, all his flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, parasols, banners, and flags, and all his musical instruments and songs emerged from all his pores and from the palms of his hands.

translated: In the same way, in the south, west, north, below and above, in each direction, all around, up to the countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhakṣetras as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, the light of that Bhagavat Amitābha always shines, except for the buddhas, bhagavats, by the power of their former vows, who abide with a light extending one fathom, or one, two, three, four, five, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty yojanas, or with a light of a hundred yojanas, or a thousand yojanas, or a hundred thousand yojanas, or up to a light of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of yojanas, filling the world. translated: He has immeasurable radiance, infinite radiance, inexhaustible radiance, unattached radiance, radiance like the flame of a lamp, divine jewel-like radiance, radiance of unobstructed light rays, captivating radiance, delightful radiance, joyful radiance, unifying radiance, radiance worthy of observance, binding radiance, extremely powerful radiance, incomparable radiance, radiance surpassing the radiance of the lords of men and the lords of the gods, the lords of the asuras, and the lords of the gandharvas.

analyzed: tathā sāṃpratam daśa kalpāḥ tasya bhagavataḥ omitāyuṣaḥ tathāgatasya utpannasya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya
translated: In the same way, ten kalpas have passed since the appearance of that Bhagavat Amitāyus, the Tathāgata, who attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tasya khalu punarānanda bhagavato'mitābhasya sukhāvatī nāma lokadhāturṛddhā ca sphītā ca kṣemā ca subhikṣā ca ramaṇīyā ca bahudevamanuṣyākīrṇā ca /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar ānanda bhagavatā umitābhasya sukhāvatī nāma lokadhātuḥ ṛddhā ca sphītā ca kṣemā ca subhikṣā ca ramaṇīyā ca bahu deva manuṣya ākīrṇā ca
translated: And, Ānanda, that world system of the Bhagavat Amitābha is called Sukhāvatī, and it is prosperous, flourishing, peaceful, well-off, delightful, and full of many gods and humans.

original: tatra khalvānanda lokadhātau na nirayāḥ santi na tiryagyonirna pretaviṣayo nāsurāḥ kāyā nākṣaṇopapattayaḥ /
analyzed: tatra khalu ānanda lokadhātau na nirayāḥ santi na tiryagyoniḥ na preta viṣayaḥ na asurāḥ kāyāḥ na akṣaṇa upapattayaḥ
translated: And, Ānanda, in that world system there are no hells, no animal realms, no realms of hungry ghosts, no asuras, and no unfortunate rebirths.

original: na ca tāni ratnāni loke pracaranti yāni sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau vidyante // //
analyzed: na ca tāni ratnāni loke pracaranti yāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau vidyante  /
translated: And those jewels that exist in the world system of Sukhāvatī do not circulate in the world.

original: sā khalvānanda sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ surabhinānāgandhasamīritā nānāpuṣpaphalasamṛddhā ratnavṛkṣasamalaṃkṛtā tathāgatābhinirmitamanojñasvaranānādvijasaṃghaniṣevitā
analyzed: sā khalu ānanda sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ surabhi nānā gandha samīritā nānā puṣpa phala samṛddhā ratna vṛkṣa samalaṃkṛtā tathāgata abhinirmita manojña svara nānā dvija saṃgha niṣevitā
translated: And, Ānanda, that world system of Sukhāvatī is fragrant with various sweet scents, abundant with various flowers and fruits, adorned with jeweled trees, and inhabited by flocks of various birds created by the Tathāgata, with beautiful voices.

original: te cānanda ratnavṛkṣā nānāvarṇā anekavarṇā anekaśatasahasravarṇāḥ /
analyzed: te ca ānanda ratna vṛkṣāḥ nānā varṇāḥ aneka varṇāḥ aneka śata sahasra varṇāḥ
translated: And, Ānanda, those jeweled trees have various colors, many colors, many hundreds of thousands of colors.

analyzed: santi tatra ratna vṛkṣāḥ suvarṇa varṇāḥ suvarṇa mayāḥ
translated: There are jewel trees there that are golden in color and made of gold.

analyzed: santi rūpya varṇāḥ rūpya mayāḥ  santi vaiḍūrya varṇāḥ vaiḍūrya mayāḥ
translated: There are some that are silver in color and made of silver.🔽There are some that are the color of beryl and made of beryl.

analyzed: santi sphaṭika varṇāḥ sphaṭika mayāḥ  santi musāragalva varṇāḥ musāragalva mayāḥ
translated: There are some that are crystal in color and made of crystal.🔽There are some that are the color of coral and made of coral.🔽There are some that are the color of red pearls and made of red pearls.

analyzed: santi lohita muktā varṇāḥ lohita muktā mayāḥ  santi aśmagarbha varṇāḥ aśmagarbha mayāḥ
translated: There are some that are the color of emerald and made of emerald.

original: santi kecid dvayo ratnayoḥ suvarṇasya rūpyasya ca /
analyzed: santi kecid dvayoḥ ratnayoḥ suvarṇasya rūpyasya ca
translated: There are some that are a combination of two jewels, gold and silver.

original: santi trayāṇāṃ ratnānāṃ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya ca /
analyzed: santi trayāṇām ratnānām suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya ca
translated: There are some that are a combination of three jewels, gold, silver, and beryl.

original: santi caturṇāṃ ratnānāṃ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya ca /
analyzed: santi caturṇām ratnānām suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya ca
translated: There are some that are a combination of four jewels, gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: santi pañcānāṃ ratnānāṃ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya ca /
analyzed: santi pañcānām ratnānām suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya ca
translated: There are some that are a combination of five jewels, gold, silver, beryl, crystal, and coral.

original: santi ṣaṇṇāṃ ratnānāṃ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitamuktāyāśca /
analyzed: santi ṣaṇṇām ratnānām suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohita muktāyāḥ ca
translated: There are some that are a combination of six jewels, gold, silver, beryl, crystal, coral, and red pearls.

original: santi saptānāṃ ratnānāṃ suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitamuktāyā aśmagarbhasya ca saptamasya /
analyzed: santi saptānām ratnānām suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya musāragalvasya lohitamuktāyāḥ aśmagarbhasya ca saptamasya
translated: There are seven kinds of jewels: gold, silver, vaiḍūrya, crystal, coral, ruby, and diamond as the seventh.

analyzed: tatra ānanda suvarṇa mayānām vṛkṣāṇām suvarṇa mayāni mūla skandha viṭapa śākhā patra puṣpāṇi
translated: Ānanda, there are golden trees with golden roots, trunks, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

translated: The roots of some of those pleasure trees are made of the seven precious substances.🔽Their trunks are made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: sapta ratna mayāḥ viṭapāḥ  sapta ratna mayāḥ śākhāḥ  sapta ratna mayāni patrāṇi

original: sarveṣāṃ cānanda teṣāṃ vṛkṣāṇāṃ mūlaskandhaviṭapaśākhāpatrapuṣpaphalāni sukhasaṃsparśāni sugandhīni /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca ānanda teṣām vṛkṣāṇām mūla skandha viṭapa śākhā patra puṣpa phalāni sukha saṃsparśāni sugandhīni
translated: And, Ānanda, the roots, trunks, branches, twigs, leaves, flowers, and fruits of all those trees are pleasant to the touch and fragrant.

original: vātena preritena ca teṣāṃ valgumanojñaghoṣo niścaratyasecanako'pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya /
analyzed: vātena preritena ca teṣām valgu manojña ghoṣaḥ niścarati asecana kopa atikūlaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: When stirred by the wind, a pleasant, delightful sound comes from them, captivating and agreeable to the ear.

original: evaṃrūpairānanda saptaratnamayairvṛkṣaiḥ saṃtataṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ samantācca kadalīskandhaiḥ saptaratnamayai ratnatālapaṅktibhiścānuparikṣiptaṃ sarvataśca hemajālapraticchannaṃ samantaśca sarvaratnamayaiḥ padmaiḥ saṃchannam /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaiḥ ānanda sapta ratna mayaiḥ vṛkṣaiḥ saṃtatam tat buddhakṣetram samantāt ca kadalī skandhaiḥ sapta ratna mayaiḥ ratna tāla paṅktibhiḥ ca anuparikṣiptam sarvatas ca hema jāla praticchannam samantar ca sarva ratna mayaiḥ padmaiḥ saṃchannam
translated: Ānanda, that buddha-field is always filled with trees made of the seven precious substances, and all around it is surrounded by rows of jeweled palm trees made of the seven precious substances, and everywhere it is covered with a net of gold, and all around it is covered with jeweled lotuses.

analyzed: santi tatra padmāni ardha yojana pramāṇāni
translated: There are lotuses there that are half a yojana in size.

analyzed: santi yojana pramāṇāni
translated: There are lotuses that are one yojana in size.

analyzed: santi dvi tri catur pañca yojana pramāṇāni
translated: There are lotuses that are two, three, four, and five yojanas in size.

analyzed: santi yāvat daśa yojana pramāṇāni
translated: There are lotuses there that are up to ten yojanas in size.

analyzed: sarvatas ca ratna padmāt ṣaṭtriṃśat raśmi koṭī śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti
translated: And from every jeweled lotus, three hundred and sixty million light rays shine forth.

analyzed: sarvatas ca raśmi mukhāt ṣaṭtriṃśat buddha koṭī śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti suvarṇa maya varṇaiḥ kāyaiḥ dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa dharaiḥ
translated: And from the tip of every light ray, three hundred and sixty million buddhas emerge with golden-colored bodies bearing the thirty-two marks of great men.

original: yāni pūrvasyāṃ diśyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāsu lokadhātuṣu gatvā sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: yāni pūrvasyām diśi aprameya asaṃkhyeyāsu lokadhātuṣu gatvā sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayanti
translated: They go to immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the eastern direction and teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇapaścimottarāsu dikṣu adha ūrdhvamanuvidikṣu gatāvaraṇe loke'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāllokadhātūn gatiṃ gattvā sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayanti tasmin khalu punarānanda buddhakṣetre sarvaśaḥ kālaparvatā na santi sarvato ratnaparvatāḥ sarvaśaḥ sumeravaḥ parvatarājāḥ sarvaśaścakravālā mahācakravālāḥ parvatarājāḥ /
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇa paścima uttarāsu dikṣu adhas ūrdhvam anu vidikṣu gata āvaraṇe loke prameya asaṃkhyeyān lokadhātūn gatim gattvā sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayanti tasmin khalu punar ānanda buddhakṣetre sarvaśas kālaparvatāḥ na santi sarvatas ratnaparvatāḥ sarvaśas sumeravaḥ parvata rājāḥ sarvaśas cakravālāḥ mahā cakravālāḥ parvata rājāḥ
translated: In the same way, in the southern, western, and northern directions, below and above, in the intermediate directions, having gone to the world systems in the ten directions, immeasurable and incalculable, they teach the Dharma to beings. In that Buddha-field, Ānanda, there are no black mountains at all, but everywhere there are mountains of jewels, everywhere Sumerus, the kings of mountains, and everywhere Cakravālas and Mahācakravālas, the kings of mountains.

original: samantācca tadbuddhakṣetraṃ samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ pāṇitalajātaṃ nānāvidharatnamaṇicitabhūmibhāgam /
analyzed: samantāt ca tat buddhakṣetram samam ramaṇīyam pāṇi tala jātam nānāvidha ratna maṇi cita bhūmi bhāgam
translated: And that Buddha-field is everywhere level, delightful, like the palm of a hand, with the ground made of various kinds of jewels and gems.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocatye ca punaste bhagavaṃścāturmahārājakāyikā devāḥ sumerupārśvanivāsinastrāyastriṃśā vā sumerumūrdhni
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat ye ca punar te bhagavan cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ sumeru pārśva nivāsinaḥ trāyastriṃśāḥ vā sumeru mūrdhni
translated: When this was said, the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One, And those gods of the Four Great Kings who dwell on the slopes of Mount Meru, or the Thirty-Three on the peak of Mount Meru,

analyzed: te kutra pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: where are they established?

original: bhagavānāhatatkiṃ manyase ānanda ye te iha sumeroḥ parvatarājasyopari yāmā devāstuṣitā vā nirmāṇaratayo vā paranirmitavaśavartino vā brahmakāyikā vā brahmapurohitā vā mahābrahmāṇo va yāvadakaniṣṭhā vā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase ānanda ye te iha sumeroḥ parvata rājasya upari yāmāḥ devāḥ tuṣitāḥ vā nirmāṇaratayaḥ vā paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ vā brahmakāyikāḥ vā brahmapurohitāḥ vā mahābrahmāṇaḥ yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ vā
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Ananda? Where are those gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven of Yāma, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Creation, the Heaven of Making Use of Others' Creations, the gods of the Brahma group, the gods who are attendants on Brahma, the great Brahma gods, up to the Akaniṣṭha gods?

analyzed: kutra te pratiṣṭhitāḥ iti
translated: Where are they established?

original: ānanda āhaacintyo bhagavan karmaṇāṃ vipākaḥ karmābhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha acintyaḥ bhagavan karmaṇām vipākaḥ karma abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: Ananda said, The ripening of karma, the performance of karma, is inconceivable, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāhalabdhastvayānanda ihācintyaḥ karmaṇāṃ vipākaḥ karmābhisaṃskāro na buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmacintyaṃ buddhādhiṣṭhānaṃ kṛtapuṇyānāṃ ca sattvānāmavaropitakuśalamūlānām /
analyzed: bhagavān āha labdhaḥ tvayā ānandaḥ iha acintyaḥ karmaṇām vipākaḥ karma abhisaṃskāraḥ na buddhānām bhagavatām acintyam buddha adhiṣṭhānam kṛta puṇyānām ca sattvānām avaropita kuśala mūlānām
translated: The Blessed One said, You have attained the inconceivable ripening of karma, the performance of karma here, but the inconceivable Buddha-adhisthāna of the Blessed Buddhas and the inconceivable merit of beings who have planted wholesome roots is not so.

analyzed: tava acintyā puṇyā vibhūtiḥ
translated: Your merit is inconceivable.

original: ānanda āhana me'tra bhagavan kācitkāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha na mā itra bhagavan kācid kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā
translated: Ananda said, I have no doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about this, Blessed One.

original: api tu khalvahamanāgatānāṃ sattvānāṃ kāṅkṣāvimativicikitsānirghātāya tathāgatametadarthaṃ paripṛcchāmi /
analyzed: api tu khalu aham anāgatānām sattvānām kāṅkṣā vimati vicikitsā nirghātāya tathāgatam etad artham paripṛcchāmi
translated: However, in order to remove the doubt, uncertainty, and skepticism of future beings, I ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu ānanda
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, Ananda!

analyzed: evam te karaṇīyam
translated: This is how you should practice.”

original: tasyāṃ khalvānanda sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau nānāprakārā nadyaḥ pracaranti /
analyzed: tasyām khalu ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau nānāprakārāḥ nadyaḥ pracaranti
translated: “Ānanda, in that Sukhāvatī world system, there flow various kinds of rivers.

analyzed: santi tatra mahā nadyaḥ yojana vistārāḥ
translated: There are great rivers there, one yojana wide,

analyzed: santi yāvat viṃśati triṃśat catvāṃriśat pañcāśat yojana vistārāḥ yāvat dvādaśa yojana āvedhāḥ
translated: up to twenty, thirty, forty, fifty yojanas wide, up to twelve yojanas deep.

original: sarvāśca tā nadyaḥ sukhavāhinyo nānāsurabhigandhavārivāhinyo nānāratnalulitapuṣpasaṃghātavāhinyo nānāmadhurasvaranirghoṣāḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ ca tāḥ nadyaḥ sukha vāhinyaḥ nānā surabhi gandha vāri vāhinyaḥ nānā ratna lulita puṣpa saṃghāta vāhinyaḥ nānā madhura svara nirghoṣāḥ
translated: All those rivers flow pleasantly, carrying various fragrant waters, masses of flowers stirred by various jewels, and various sweet sounds.

original: tāsāṃ cānanda koṭiśatasahasrāṅgasaṃprayuktasya divyasaṃgītisamūrcchitasya tūryasya kuśalaiḥ saṃpravāditasya tāvanmanojñaghoṣo niścarati yathārūpastāsāṃ mahānadīnāṃ nirghoṣo niścarati gambhīro'jñeyo'vijñeyo'nelaḥ karṇasukho hṛdayaṃgamaḥ premaṇīyo valgurmanojño'secanako'pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya /
analyzed: tāsām ca ānanda koṭi śata sahasra aṅga saṃprayuktasya divya saṃgīti sa mūrcchitasya tūryasya kuśalaiḥ saṃpravāditasya tāvat manojña ghoṣaḥ niścarati yathārūpaḥ tāsām mahā nadīnām nirghoṣaḥ niścarati gambhīraḥ jñeyaḥ vijñeyaḥ nelaḥ karṇa sukhaḥ hṛdayaṃgamaḥ premaṇīyaḥ valguḥ manojñaḥ secanakaḥ pratikūlaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: Ānanda, the pleasant sound that comes forth from that divine music, which is composed of a hundred thousand koṭis of parts, and is played by skilled musicians, is just like the sound that comes forth from those great rivers, which is deep, incomprehensible, unknown, pleasant to the ear, touching the heart, lovable, charming, delightful, not grating on the ears.

original: anityaṃ śāntamanātmeti sukhaśravanīyo yasteṣāṃ sattvānāṃ śrotrendriyābhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: anityam śāntam anātmā iti sukha śravanīyaḥ yaḥ teṣām sattvānām śrotra indriya ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: Impermanent, peaceful, and without self, which is pleasant to hear and comes within the range of the ear faculty of those beings.

original: tāsāṃ khalu punarānanda mahānadīnāmubhayatastīrāṇi nānāgandharatnavṛkṣaiḥ saṃtatāni /
analyzed: tāsām khalu punar ānanda mahā nadīnām ubhayatas tīrāṇi nānā gandha ratna vṛkṣaiḥ saṃtatāni
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, the banks of those great rivers are covered with various fragrant jeweled trees,

analyzed: yebhyaḥ nānā śākhā patra puṣpa mañjaryaḥ uvalambante
translated: from which various branches, leaves, flowers, and bouquets hang down.

original: tatra ye sattvāsteṣu nadītīreṣvākāṅkṣanti divyābhirāmaramaṇīyāṃ ratikrīḍāṃ cānubhavitum /
analyzed: tatra ye sattvāḥ teṣu nadī tīreṣu ākāṅkṣanti divya abhirāma ramaṇīyām rati krīḍām ca anubhavitum
translated: There, those beings who desire on the banks of those rivers to experience divine, delightful, and pleasurable play,

original: teṣāṃ tatra nadīṣvavatīrṇānāmākāṅkṣatāṃ gulphamātraṃ vāri saṃtiṣṭhate /🔽ākāṅkṣatāṃ jānumātraṃ kaṭimātraṃ kakṣamātram /
analyzed: teṣām tatra nadīṣu avatīrṇānām ākāṅkṣatām gulpha mātram vāri saṃtiṣṭhate  ākāṅkṣatām jānu mātram kaṭi mātram kakṣa mātram
translated: for them, when they enter those rivers and desire it, the water stands only up to their ankles.🔽For those who desire it, it stands only up to their knees, hips, and armpits.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣatām karṇa mātram vāri saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: For those who desire it, the water stands only up to their ears.

analyzed: divyāḥ ca ratayaḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: And divine pleasures appear.

original: tatra ye sattvā ākāṅkṣanti śītaṃ vāri bhavatviti /
analyzed: tatra ye sattvāḥ ākāṅkṣanti śītam vāri bhavatu iti
translated: There, those beings who desire, Let the water be cool,

original: teṣāṃ śītaṃ vāri bhavati /🔽ya ākāṅkṣanyuṣṇaṃ bhavatviti /
analyzed: teṣām śītam vāri bhavati  yaḥ ākāṅkṣan yuṣṇam bhavatu iti
translated: for them the water becomes cool.🔽Those who desire, Let it be warm,

analyzed: teṣām uṣṇam bhavati
translated: for them it becomes warm.

analyzed: ye ākāṅkṣanti śīta uṣṇam bhavatu iti
translated: Those who desire, Let it be cool and warm,

analyzed: teṣām śīta uṣṇam eva tat vāri bhavati anusukham
translated: For them, that water is neither too cold nor too hot, but just pleasant.

original: tāśca mahānadyo divyatamālapatrāgarukālānusāritagaroragasāracandanavaragandhavāsitavāriparipūrṇāḥ pravahanti divyotpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkasaugandhikādipuṣpasaṃchannā haṃsasārasakrauñcacakravākakāraṇḍavaśukaśārikakokilakuṇālakalaviṅkamayūrādimanojñasvarāstathāgatābhinirmitapakṣisaṃghaniṣevitapulinā dhārtarāṣṭropaśobhitāḥ sūpatīrthā vikardamāḥ suvarṇavālukāsaṃkirṇāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ca mahā nadyaḥ divya tamāla patra agaru kāla anusārita gara uraga sāra candana vara gandha vāsita vāri paripūrṇāḥ pravahanti divya utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka saugandhika ādi puṣpa saṃchannāḥ haṃsa sārasa krauñca cakravāka kāraṇḍava śuka śārika kokila kuṇāla kalaviṅka mayūra ādi manojña svarāḥ tathāgata abhinirmita pakṣi saṃgha niṣevita pulināḥ dhārtarāṣṭra upaśobhitāḥ su upatīrthāḥ vikardamāḥ suvarṇa vālukā saṃki
translated: Those great rivers flow filled with water perfumed with the most divine tamāla leaves, agaru, kālānusāri, tagara, and uragasāra sandalwood, covered with divine lotuses, blue lotuses, campaka, and saugandhika flowers, with the pleasant sounds of geese, cranes, curlews, ruddy geese, karandavas, parrots, mynas, cuckoos, kuṇālas, kalaviṅkas, peacocks, and other birds, with sandy banks frequented by flocks of birds magically created by the Tathāgata, adorned with dharatāla, with easy access, without mud, strewn with golden sand.

original: tatra yadā te sattvā ākāṅkṣanti kīdṛśā asmākamabhiprāyāḥ paripūryantāmiti /
analyzed: tatra yadā te sattvāḥ ākāṅkṣanti kīdṛśāḥ asmākam abhiprāyāḥ paripūryantām iti
translated: There, when those beings wish, 'May our desires be fulfilled,'

analyzed: tadā teṣām tādṛśāḥ eva abhiprāyā paripūryante
translated: then their desires are fulfilled in just that way.

original: yaścāsāvānanda tasya vāriṇo nirghoṣaḥ sa manojño niścarati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca asau ānanda tasya vāriṇaḥ nirghoṣaḥ sa manojñaḥ niścarati
translated: And, Ānanda, the sound of that water is pleasant.

analyzed: yena sarvāvat tat buddhakṣetram abhijñāpyate
translated: It is heard throughout that entire Buddha-field.

original: ye ca sattvā nadītīreṣu sthitā ākāṅkṣanti mā asmākamayaṃ śabdaḥ śrotrendriyāvabhāsamāgacchatviti /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ nadī tīreṣu sthitāḥ ākāṅkṣanti mā asmākam ayam śabdaḥ śrotra indriya avabhāsam āgacchatu iti
translated: And those beings who are on the banks of rivers, who desire, May this sound come within the range of our ear faculty,

original: teṣāṃ na divyasyāpi śrotrendriyasyāvabhāsamāgacchati /🔽yaśca yathārūpaṃ śabdamākāṅkṣati śrotum /
analyzed: teṣām na divyasya api śrotra indriyasya avabhāsam āgacchati  yaḥ ca yathārūpam śabdam ākāṅkṣati śrotum
translated: for them it does not come within the range of even their divine ear faculty.🔽And whoever desires to hear a sound of a certain kind,

analyzed: sa tathārūpam eva manojñam śabdam śṛṇoti
translated: he hears a sound that is just as pleasant.

original: tadyathābuddhaśabdaṃ dharmaśabdaṃ saṃghaśabdaṃ pāramitāśabdaṃ bhūmiśabdaṃ balaśabdaṃ vaiśāradyaśabdamāveṇikabuddhadharmaśabdaṃ pratisaṃvicchabdaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitānabhisaṃskārājātānutpādābhāvanirodhaśabdaṃ śāntapraśāntopaśāntaṃ mahāmaitrīmahākarūṇāmahāmuditāmahopekṣāśabdamanutpattikadharmakṣāntyabhiṣekabhūmipratilambhaśabdam śrutvā udāraprītiprāmodyaṃ pratilabhate vivekasahagataṃ virāgasahagataṃ śāntasahagataṃ nirodhasahagataṃ dharmasahagataṃ bodhipariniṣpattikuśalamūlasahagataṃ ca /
analyzed: tat yathā buddha śabdam dharma śabdam saṃgha śabdam pāramitā śabdam bhūmi śabdam bala śabdam vaiśāradya śabdam āveṇika buddha dharma śabdam pratisaṃvid śabdam śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita an abhisaṃskāra ajāta anutpāda abhāva nirodha śabdam śānta praśānta upaśāntam mahā maitrī mahākarūṇā mahāmuditā mahā upekṣā śabdam anutpattika dharma kṣānti abhiṣeka bhūmi pratilambha śabdam śrutvā udāra prīti prāmodyam pratilabhate viveka sahagatam virāga s
translated: Hearing the words of the Buddha, the words of the Dharma, the words of the Saṅgha, the words of the perfections, the words of the stages, the words of the powers, the words of the fearlessnesses, the words of the unique qualities of the Buddha, the words of the analytical knowledges, the words of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance, non-arising, non-production, absence, cessation, the words of peace, tranquility, and complete peace, the words of great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, the words of attaining the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, the consecration, and the stages, one attains exalted joy and rapture accompanied by seclusion, dispassion, cessation, and the skillful roots that lead to the completion of enlightenment.

analyzed: sarvaśas ca ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau akuśala śabdaḥ na asti
translated: And, Ānanda, in the world-system Sukhāvatī there is no sound of what is unwholesome.

analyzed: sarvaśas nīvaraṇa śabdaḥ na asti  sarvaśas upāya durgati vinipāta śabdaḥ na asti
translated: There is no sound of the hindrances.🔽There is no sound of the lower realms, unfortunate destinies, or falling into bad rebirths.

analyzed: sarvaśas duḥkha śabdaḥ na asti
translated: There is no sound of suffering at all.

analyzed: aduḥkha asukha vedanā śabdaḥ api tāvat ānanda tatra na asti
translated: Even the word 'neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling' does not exist there, Ananda.

analyzed: kutas punar duḥkha śabdaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How much less the word 'suffering' could there be?

original: tadanena ānanda paryāyeṇa sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatītyucyate saṃkṣiptena /
analyzed: tat anena ānanda paryāyeṇa sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatī iti ucyate saṃkṣiptena
translated: By this method, Ananda, that world sphere is called 'Sukhāvatī' in brief.

original: na punarvistareṇa kalpo'pyānanda parikṣayaṃ gacchetsukhāvatyā lokadhātoḥ sukhakāraṇeṣu parikīrtyamāneṣu /
analyzed: na punar vistareṇa kalpaḥ api ānanda parikṣayam gacchet sukhāvatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ sukha kāraṇeṣu parikīrtyamāneṣu
translated: Even if one were to speak for an eon, Ananda, one could not fully describe the causes of happiness in the world sphere 'Sukhāvatī'.

original: na tveva śakyaṃ teṣāṃ sukhakāraṇānāṃ paryantamadhigantum // //
analyzed: na tu eva śakyam teṣām sukha kāraṇānām paryantam adhigantum
translated: But one could not reach the end of describing those causes of happiness.

original: tasyāṃ khalu punarānanda sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau ye sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ pratyājaniṣyante /
analyzed: tasyām khalu punar ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau ye sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ pratyājaniṣyante
translated: And, Ananda, all the beings who have been reborn or will be reborn in that 'Sukhāvatī' world sphere,

original: sarve te evaṃrūpeṇa varṇena balena sthāmnā ārohapariṇāhena ādhipatyena puṇyasaṃcayena atiṣṇabhirvastrābharaṇodyānavimānakūṭāgāraparibhogairevaṃrūpaśabdagandharasasparśaparibhogaiḥ evaṃrūpaiśca sarvairapi bhogaparibhogaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te evaṃrūpeṇa varṇena balena sthāmnā āroha pariṇāhena ādhipatyena puṇya saṃcayena atiṣṇabhiḥ vastra ābharaṇa udyāna vimāna kūṭāgāra paribhogaiḥ evaṃrūpa śabda gandha rasa sparśa paribhogaiḥ evaṃrūpaiḥ ca sarvaiḥ api bhoga paribhogaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ
translated: they will all be endowed with such form, complexion, strength, firmness, height, breadth, dominion, accumulation of merit, and with such excellent garments, ornaments, parks, palaces, and kūṭāgāras, and with such sounds, smells, tastes, and touches, and with all such enjoyments and possessions,

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma devāḥ paranirmita vaśavartinaḥ
translated: just like the gods who have power over others' emanations.🔽And, Ananda, in that 'Sukhāvatī' world sphere, there are no hells, no animal realm, no ghost realm, no asuras, and no such distinctions as 'this is a man,' 'this is a woman,' 'this is a householder,' 'this is a monastic,' 'this is a god,' 'this is a human.'

original: na khalu punarānanda sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau sattvā audārikayūṣaphāṇitākārāhāramāharanti /
analyzed: na khalu punar ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau sattvāḥ audārika yūṣa phāṇita ākāra āhāram āharanti
translated: “Ānanda, in the world system Sukhāvatī, beings do not eat food that is coarse and in the form of gruel and soup.

analyzed: api tu khalu punar yathārūpam eva aharam ākāṅkṣanti
translated: Rather, whatever kind of food they desire,

analyzed: tathārūpam āhṛtam eva saṃjānanti
translated: they perceive that they have eaten it.

analyzed: prīṇita kāyāḥ ca bhavanti prīṇita mānāḥ
translated: Their bodies are satisfied and their minds are satisfied.

original: na teṣāṃ bhūyaḥ kāye prakṣepaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: na teṣām bhūyas kāye prakṣepaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: They do not need to put anything else in their bodies.🔽With their bodies satisfied, they desire various kinds of smells.

original: te prīṇitakāyāstathārūpāṇi gandhajātānyākāṅkṣantiīddaśaireva gandhajātairdivyaistadbuddhakṣetraṃ sarvameva nirdhūpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: te prīṇita kāyāḥ tathārūpāṇi gandha jātāni ākāṅkṣanti īddaśaiḥ eva gandha jātaiḥ divyaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram sarvam eva nirdhūpitam bhavati
translated: That entire buddhafield is pervaded by those divine smells.

analyzed: tatra yaḥ tam gandham āghrātu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: Whoever desires to smell that smell

original: tasya sarvaśo gandharvarājño vāsanā na samudācarati /
analyzed: tasya sarvaśas gandharva rājñaḥ vāsanā na samudācarati
translated: does not experience the desire of the king of the gandharvas.

analyzed: evam ye yathārūpāṇi gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā tūryāṇi ākāṅkṣanti
translated: In the same way, whoever desires various kinds of perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and musical instruments,

original: teṣāṃ tathārūpaiśca taiḥ sarvaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ parisphuṭaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām tathārūpaiḥ ca taiḥ sarvam tat buddhakṣetram parisphuṭam bhavati
translated: that entire buddhafield is filled with those things.

analyzed: cīvarāṇi ākāṅkṣanti nānā varṇāni aneka śata sahasra varṇāni
translated: They desire robes of various colors, with many hundreds of thousands of colors.

original: teṣāṃ tādṛśaireva cīvararatnaiḥ sarvaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ parisphuṭaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām tādṛśaiḥ eva cīvara ratnaiḥ sarvam tat buddhakṣetram parisphuṭam bhavati
translated: And that entire buddha field is filled with such jewel robes.

analyzed: prāvṛtam eva ca ātmānam saṃjānanti
translated: And they perceive themselves as being clothed.

analyzed: te yathārūpāṇi ābharaṇāni ākāṅkṣanti
translated: And they perceive themselves as being adorned with ornaments of various kinds,

original: tadyathāśīrṣābharaṇāni vā karṇābharaṇāni vā grīvābharaṇāni vā hastapādābharaṇāni vā yadidaṃ mukuṭāni kuṇḍalāni kaṭakakeyūrāṇi vatsahārā rūcakahārā karṇikā mudrikāḥ svarṇasūtrāṇi mekhalāḥ svarṇasūtāṇi jālāni muktājālāni sarvaratnajālāni svarṇaratnakiṅkiṇījālāni /
analyzed: tat yathā śīrṣa ābharaṇāni vā karṇa ābharaṇāni vā grīvā ābharaṇāni vā hasta pāda ābharaṇāni vā yat idam mukuṭāni kuṇḍalāni kaṭaka keyūrāṇi vatsa hārā rūcaka hārā karṇikā mudrikāḥ svarṇa sūtrāṇi mekhalāḥ svarṇa sūtāṇi jālāni muktā jālāni sarva ratna jālāni svarṇa ratna kiṅkiṇī jālāni
translated: such as head ornaments, ear ornaments, neck ornaments, arm and leg ornaments, crowns, earrings, bracelets, armlets, necklaces, jeweled necklaces, medallions, signet rings, golden threads, girdles, nets of golden threads, nets of pearls, nets of all jewels, nets of golden jeweled bells.

analyzed: tathārūpaiḥ ābharaṇaiḥ aneka ratna śata sahasra pratyuptaiḥ sphuṭam tat buddhakṣetram paśyanti yat idam ābharaṇa vṛkṣa avasaktaiḥ
translated: They see that buddha field filled with such ornaments, which are hung on the wish-fulfilling trees, and which are adorned with many hundreds of thousands of jewels.

analyzed: taiḥ ca ābharaṇaiḥ alaṃkṛtam ātmānam saṃjānanti
translated: And they perceive themselves as being adorned with those ornaments.

original: te yādṛśaṃ vimānamākāṅkṣanti yadvarṇaliṅgasaṃsthānaṃ yāvadārohapariṇāhaṃ nānāratnamayaniryūhaśatasahasrasamalaṃkṛtaṃ nānādivyapuṣpasaṃstīrṇaṃ
analyzed: te yādṛśam vimānam ākāṅkṣanti yat varṇa liṅga saṃsthānam yāvat āroha pariṇāham nānā ratna maya niryūha śata sahasra samalaṃkṛtam nānā divya puṣpa saṃstīrṇam
translated: Whatever kind of palace they desire, with such a color, shape, and size, up to the height and circumference, adorned with hundreds of thousands of balconies made of various jewels, strewn with various divine flowers,

analyzed: tādṛśam eva vimānam teṣām puratas prādurbhavati
translated: just such a palace appears before them.

original: teṣu manonirvṛtteṣu vimāneṣu saptasaptāsparasahasraparivṛtāḥ puraskṛtā viharanti krīḍanti ramante paricārayanti // //
analyzed: teṣu manaḥ nirvṛtteṣu vimāneṣu sapta sapta āspara sahasra parivṛtāḥ puraskṛtāḥ viharanti krīḍanti ramante paricārayanti
translated: In those mind-made palaces, surrounded and attended by seven thousand Apsarases each, they dwell, play, enjoy, and amuse themselves.

original: na ca tatra lokadhātau devānāṃ vā manuṣyāṇāṃ vā nānātvamasti anyatra saṃvṛtivyavahāreṇa devamanuṣyāviti saṃkhyāṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: na ca tatra lokadhātau devānām vā manuṣyāṇām vā nānātvam asti anyatra saṃvṛti vyavahāreṇa deva manuṣyau iti saṃkhyām gacchanti
translated: And in that world system there is no distinction of gods or humans, except that by conventional designation they are counted as gods and humans.

original: tadyathā ānanda rājñaścakravartinaḥ purato manuṣyahīno manuṣyapretako na bhāsate na tapate na virocate /
analyzed: tat yathā ānanda rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ puratas manuṣya hīnaḥ manuṣya pretakaḥ na bhāsate na tapate na virocate
translated: Just as, Ānanda, a human being of low caste does not shine, does not glow, does not gleam in the presence of a universal monarch,

original: na ca bhavati viśārado na prabhāśvaraḥ /
analyzed: na ca bhavati viśāradaḥ na prabhāśvaraḥ
translated: and is not confident, not brilliant,

original: evameva devānāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ purataḥ śakro devānāmindro na bhāsate na tapate na virocate yadidamudyānavimānavastrābharaṇairādhipatyena ṛddhyā vā prātihāryeṇa vā aiśvaryeṇa vā ānanda /
analyzed: evam eva devānām paranirmitavaśavartinām puratas śakraḥ devānām indraḥ na bhāsate na tapate na virocate yat idam udyāna vimāna vastra ābharaṇaiḥ ādhipatyena ṛddhyā vā prātihāryeṇa vā aiśvaryeṇa vā ānanda
translated: In the same way, Śakra, lord of the gods, does not shine, does not glow, does not dazzle in front of the gods who control enjoyments magically created by others, Ananda, by his gardens, palaces, clothes, ornaments, sovereignty, magical power, miracles, or lordship.

analyzed: sa khalu dharma abhisamayena dharma paribhogeṇa vā
translated: He is, however, by his realization of the Dharma and his enjoyment of the Dharma.

analyzed: tatra ānanda yathā devāḥ parinirmita vaśavartinaḥ
translated: There, Ananda, as the gods who control enjoyments magically created by others,

analyzed: evam sukhāvatyām lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: so should the humans in the world system Sukhāvatī be seen.

original: tasyāṃ khalu punarānanda sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau pūrvāhṇakālasamaye pratyupasthite samantāccaturdiśamākulāḥ samākulā vāyavo vānti /
analyzed: tasyām khalu punar ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau pūrvāhṇa kāla samaye pratyupasthite samantāt caturdiśam ākulāḥ samākulāḥ vāyavaḥ vānti
translated: And again, Ānanda, in that world system Sukhāvatī, when the morning time arrives, breezes blow from all four directions, from the east, south, west, and north, gentle, not violent, not rough, not harsh, not hot, not cold, not salty, not bitter, not sour, not pungent, but sweet, fragrant, and pleasant to the touch.

original: teṣāṃ ratnavṛkṣāṇāṃ citrān darśanīyān nānāvarṇānanekavṛntān nānāsurabhidivyagandhaparivāsitān kṣobhayanti saṃkṣobhayanti īrayanti samīrayanti yato bahūni puṣpaśatāni tasyāṃ ratnamayyāṃ mahāpṛthivyāṃ prapatanti manojñagandhāni darśanīyāni /
analyzed: teṣām ratna vṛkṣāṇām citrān darśanīyān nānā varṇān aneka vṛntān nānā surabhi divya gandha parivāsitān kṣobhayanti saṃkṣobhayanti īrayanti samīrayanti yatas bahūni puṣpa śatāni tasyām ratna mayyām mahā pṛthivyām prapatanti manojña gandhāni darśanīyāni
translated: They shake, stir, move, and cause to move the colorful, beautiful, many-colored, many-shaped, and fragrant jeweled trees, from which many hundreds of flowers fall onto the great jeweled earth, with delightful fragrances and beautiful appearances.

analyzed: taiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram samantāt sapta pauruṣam saṃskṛta rūpam bhavati
translated: With those flowers, the Buddha-field is covered up to seven human heights all around.

original: tadyathāpi nāma puruṣaḥ kuśalaḥ pṛthivyāṃ puṣpasaṃstaraṃ saṃstṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma puruṣaḥ kuśalaḥ pṛthivyām puṣpa saṃstaram saṃstṛṇuyāt
translated: Just as a skilled person would spread a carpet of flowers on the ground,

analyzed: ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām samam racayet su citram darśanīyam
translated: and with both hands would arrange it evenly, making it very colorful and beautiful,

original: evameva tadbuddhakṣetraṃ taiḥ puṣpairnānāgandhavarṇaiḥ samantātsaptapauruṣaṃ sphuṭaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva tat buddhakṣetram taiḥ puṣpaiḥ nānā gandha varṇaiḥ samantāt sapta pauruṣam sphuṭam bhavati
translated: in the same way, that Buddha-field is filled all around up to seven human heights with flowers of various fragrances and colors.

original: tāni ca puṣpajātāni mṛdūni kācilindikasukhasaṃsparśāni aupamyamātreṇa /🔽yāni nikṣipte pāde caturaṅgulamavanamanti /
analyzed: tāni ca puṣpa jātāni mṛdūni kācilindika sukha saṃsparśāni aupamya mātreṇa  yāni nikṣipte pāde catur aṅgulam avanamanti
translated: And those flowers are soft, with a pleasant touch like kācilindika cloth, only as an analogy.🔽When a foot is placed on them, they sink down four finger-widths.

analyzed: utkṣipte pāde catur aṅgulam eva unnamanti
translated: When the foot is lifted, they rise up four finger-widths.

original: nirgate punaḥ pūrvāhṇakālasamaye tāni puṣpāṇi niravaśeṣamantardhīyante /
analyzed: nirgate punar pūrvāhṇa kāla samaye tāni puṣpāṇi niravaśeṣam antardhīyante
translated: When the morning time has passed, those flowers completely disappear.

original: athe tadbuddhakṣetraṃ viviktaṃ ramyaṃ śubhaṃ bhavatyaparikliṣṭaiḥ pūrvapuṣpaiḥ /
analyzed: athe tat buddhakṣetram viviktam ramyam śubham bhavati aparikliṣṭaiḥ pūrva puṣpaiḥ
translated: Then that Buddha-field becomes secluded, delightful, and pure, with the old flowers gone.

analyzed: tatas punar api samantāt caturdiśam vāyavaḥ vānti
translated: Then again, winds blow from all four directions,

analyzed: ye pūrvavat abhinavāni puṣpāṇi abhiprakiranti
translated: which scatter new flowers as before.

analyzed: yathā pūrvāhṇe
translated: As in the morning,

original: evaṃ madhyāhnakālasamaye saṃdhyāyāṃ rātryāḥ prathame yāme madhyame yāme paścime yāme /
analyzed: evam madhyāhna kāla samaye saṃdhyāyām rātryāḥ prathame yāme madhyame yāme paścime yāme
translated: so in the midday, in the evening, in the first watch of the night, in the middle watch of the night, and in the last watch of the night.

original: taiśca vātairvāyadbhirnānāgandhaparivāsitaiste sattvāḥ spṛṣṭāḥ santaḥ evaṃ sukhasamarpitā bhavanti tadyathāpi nāma nirodhasamāpanno bhikṣuḥ tasmiścānanda buddhakṣetre sarvaśo'gnisūryacandragrahanakṣatratārārūpāṇāṃ tamondhakārasya nāmadheyaprajñapraptirapi nāsti /
analyzed: taiḥ ca vātaiḥ vāyadbhiḥ nānā gandha parivāsitaiḥ te sattvāḥ spṛṣṭāḥ santaḥ evam sukha samarpitāḥ bhavanti tat yathā api nāma nirodha samāpannaḥ bhikṣuḥ tasmin ca ānanda buddhakṣetre sarvaśas ugni sūrya candra graha nakṣatra tārā rūpāṇām tamaḥ undhakārasya nāmadheya prajña praptiḥ api nā asti
translated: And those beings, when touched by those winds blowing with various fragrances, become so blissful that it is as if a monk who has attained the attainment of cessation. And in that Buddha-field, Ānanda, there is no mention of fire, sun, moon, planets, stars, constellations, or darkness at all.

original: sarvaśo rātriṃdivaṃ prajñaptirapi nāsti anyatra tathāgatavyavahārāt /
analyzed: sarvaśas rātriṃdivam prajñaptiḥ api nā asti anyatra tathāgata vyavahārāt
translated: There is no distinction of day and night at all, except for the activities of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: sarvaśas ca ārāma parigraha saṃjñā na asti
translated: And there is no concept of the appropriation of a park anywhere.

original: tasyāṃ khalu punarānanda sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau kāle divyagandhodakameghā abhipravarṣayanti divyāni sarvavarṇikāni kusumāni /
analyzed: tasyām khalu punar ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau kāle divya gandha udaka meghāḥ abhipravarṣayanti divyāni sarva varṇikāni kusumāni
translated: “Ānanda, in that Sukhāvatī world realm, at the right time, clouds of divine fragrant water rain down, and divine flowers of all colors,

analyzed: divyāni sapta ratnāni
translated: divine seven-jeweled [flowers],

analyzed: divyam candana cūrṇam
translated: divine sandalwood powder,

analyzed: divyāḥ chatra dhvaja patākāḥ abhipravarṣayanti
translated: divine parasols, banners, and flags rain down.

analyzed: divyāni sarva varṇikāni kusumāni
translated: Divine flowers of all colors rain down.

analyzed: divyāni vitānāni dhriyante
translated: Divine canopies are held aloft.

original: divyāni cchatraratnāni sarvābharaṇānyākāśe dhriyante /🔽divyāni vādyāni pravādyante /
analyzed: divyāni chatra ratnāni sarva ābharaṇāni ākāśe dhriyante  divyāni vādyāni pravādyante
translated: Divine jeweled parasols and all ornaments are held aloft in the sky.🔽Divine musical instruments are played.

analyzed: divyāḥ ca apsarasaḥ nṛtyanti
translated: Divine celestial maidens dance.

original: tasmin khalu punarānanda buddhakṣetre ye sattvā upapannā utpadyante utpasyante /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar ānanda buddhakṣetre ye sattvāḥ upapannāḥ utpadyante
translated: “Ānanda, in that buddha-field, all the beings who have been born, are being born, and will be born

analyzed: sarve te niyatāḥ samyaktve yāvat nirvāṇam
translated: are all destined for rightness up to nirvāṇa.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: nāsti tatra dvayo rāśyorvyavasthānaṃ prajñaptirvā yadidamaniyatasya vā mithyātvaniyatasya vā /
analyzed: na asti tatra dvayoḥ rāśyoḥ vyavasthānam prajñaptiḥ vā yat idam aniyatasya vā mithyātva niyatasya vā
translated: There is no establishment or designation of the two heaps there, namely of the undetermined or of those destined for wrongness.

original: tadanenāpyānanda paryāyeṇa sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatītyucyate saṃkṣiptena /
analyzed: tat anena api ānanda paryāyeṇa sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatī iti ucyate saṃkṣiptena
translated: By this method, Ananda, that world system is called Sukhavati, in brief.

analyzed: na punar vistareṇa
translated: Not in detail.

original: kalpo'pyānanda parikṣīyeta sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau sukhakāraṇeṣu parikīrtyamāneṣu /
analyzed: kalpaḥ api ānanda parikṣīyeta sukhāvatyām lokadhātau sukha kāraṇeṣu parikīrtyamāneṣu
translated: Ananda, an eon would come to an end before one could finish describing the causes of happiness in the world system Sukhavati.

original: na ca teṣāṃ sukhakāraṇānāṃ śakyaṃ paryantamadhigantum // //
analyzed: na ca teṣām sukha kāraṇānām śakyam paryantam adhigantum
translated: And one could not reach the end of describing those causes of happiness.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

analyzed: sarve api sattvāḥ sukhitāḥ bhaveyu
translated: May all beings be happy,

analyzed: r viśuddha jñānāḥ parama artha kovidāḥ  te kalpa koṭīm atha vā api ca uttarim
translated: with pure knowledge, skilled in ultimate truth.

analyzed: prakāśayeyuḥ  kṣaye kalpa koṭī vajre surāḥ ca
translated: They could describe the praises of Sukhavati for eons or even more,🔽but the praises of Sukhavati would not come to an end.🔽Even if the praises of Sukhavati were to continue for eons,

analyzed: sukhāvatīye na ca varṇasāruḥ
translated: the praises of Sukhavati would not come to an end.🔽Even if they were to describe the praises of Sukhavati for eons,

original: kṣayaṃ na gacchetpratibhā ca teṣāṃ🔽prakāśayantāna tu varṇa nānāṃ // //
analyzed: kṣayam na gacchet pratibhā ca teṣām  prakāśayantāna tu varṇa nānām
translated: their eloquence would not come to an end.

analyzed: ye lokadhātū paramāṇu sādṛśām
translated: If one were to reduce all the world systems to atoms,

analyzed: śchidyeya bhidyeya rajaḥ ca kuryāt
translated: and cut, break, and grind them into dust,

analyzed: atas bahu uttari lokadhātu
translated: and fill with jewels as many world systems as that,

analyzed: pūreta dānam dadyāt
translated: and give them as a gift,

analyzed: nā etā kalā api upamā api tasya
translated: that would not be equal to a sixteenth part of the praises of Sukhavati.

analyzed: puṇyasya bhonti pṛthu lokadhātavaḥ  ye sukhāvatīye
translated: They will have vast buddha realms.🔽Those who hear the name of the buddha realm Sukhāvatī

analyzed: śrutvā eva nāmam bhavati iha puṇyam
translated: Will have merit here.

analyzed: tatas bahu puṇya bhaveta teṣām
translated: Then they will have much merit,

analyzed: ye śraddhate jina vacanam sa prajñāḥ
translated: Those who have wisdom and faith in the Buddha's words.

analyzed: śraddhā hi mūlam jagatasya prāptaye
translated: Faith is the root for attaining the world,

analyzed: tasmāt hi śrutvā vicitim vinodayet iti
translated: Therefore, having heard, one should eliminate doubt.

analyzed: evam aprameya guṇa varṇā ānanda sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ
translated: Thus, Ānanda, the buddha realm Sukhāvatī has immeasurable qualities and praises.🔽Ānanda, in the ten directions, in each direction, in buddha realms as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, buddhas, bhagavats as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River proclaim the name

original: tasya khalu punarānanda bhagavato'mitābhasya tathāgatasya daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukāsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gaṅgānadīvālukāsamā buddhā bhagavanto nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayante /🔽varṇaṃ bhāṣante /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar ānanda bhagavatā umitābhasya tathāgatasya daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayante  varṇam bhāṣante
translated: of that bhagavat, the tathāgata Amitābha.🔽They speak his praises.

analyzed: yaśaḥ prakāśayanti
translated: They proclaim his fame.

analyzed: guṇam udīrayanti
translated: They extol his qualities.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ye kecid sattvāḥ tasya bhagavataḥ umitābhasya nāmadheyam śṛṇvanti
translated: Whatever beings hear the name of that bhagavat Amitābha,

analyzed: śrutvā ca antaśas eka citta utpādam api adhyāśayena prasāda sahagatena cittam utpādayanti
translated: And having heard it, at least for a single moment, with a superior intention, they should generate faith and a mind accompanied with faith.

analyzed: te sarvevaivartika tāyām santi anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: All of them are established in irreversibility from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ye cānanda kecitsattvāstaṃ tathāgataṃ punaḥ satkāramanasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca ānanda kecid sattvāḥ tam tathāgatam punar satkāra manasikariṣyanti
translated: And, Ananda, whatever beings will again bring to mind the recollection of that Tathagata,

analyzed: bahu aparimitam kuśala mūlam avaropayiṣyanti bodhaye cittam pariṇāmya
translated: and plant many roots of virtue, dedicating their minds to enlightenment,

analyzed: tatra ca lokadhātau upapattaye praṇidhāsyanti
translated: and make a vow to be reborn in that world system,

original: teṣāṃ so'mitābhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho maraṇakālasamaye pratyupasthite'nekabhikṣugaṇaparivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: teṣām somitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ maraṇa kāla samaye pratyupasthitena eka bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ sthāsyati
translated: at the time of their death, when the Tathagata Amitabha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, surrounded and revered by a multitude of many monks, will stand before them.

original: tataste taṃ bhagavantaṃ dṛṣṭvā prasannacittāścyutāḥ santastatraiva sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante /
analyzed: tatas te tam bhagavantam dṛṣṭvā prasanna cittāḥ cyutāḥ santaḥ tatra eva sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Then, having seen that Blessed One with a clear mind, they will pass away and be reborn right there in the world system Sukhavati.

original: yaśca ānanda ākāṅkṣeta kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā kimityahaṃ dṛṣṭa eva dharme tamamitābhaṃ tathāgataṃ paśyeyamiti /
analyzed: yaḥ ca ānandaḥ ākāṅkṣeta kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā kim iti aham dṛṣṭe eva dharme tam amitābham tathāgatam paśyeyam iti
translated: And, Ananda, whatever son or daughter of good family should wish, 'How may I see that Tathagata Amitabha in this very life?'

original: tenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādya adhyāśayātiśayatayā saṃtatyā tasmin buddhakṣetre cittaṃ saṃpreṣya upapattaye kuśalamūlāni ca pariṇāmayitavyāni ye punastaṃ tathāgataṃ na bhūyo manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: tena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya adhyāśaya atiśaya tayā saṃtatyā tasmin buddhakṣetre cittam saṃpreṣya upapattaye kuśala mūlāni ca pariṇāmayitavyāni ye punar tam tathāgatam na bhūyas manasikariṣyanti
translated: Therefore, having generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, with superior superior intentions, having continuously directed the mind towards that Buddha-field, one should dedicate the roots of merit for rebirth there. But those who will not repeatedly bring to mind that Tathāgata,

analyzed: na ca bahu aparimitam kuśala mūlam abhīkṣṇam avaropayiṣyanti
translated: and will not repeatedly plant abundant and immeasurable roots of merit,

original: teṣāṃ tādṛśenaiva so'mitābhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho varṇasaṃsthānārohapariṇāhena bhikṣusaṃghaparivāreṇa ca tādṛśa eva buddhinirmito maraṇakālasamaye purataḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: teṣām tādṛśena eva somitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ varṇa saṃsthāna āroha pariṇāhena bhikṣu saṃgha parivāreṇa ca tādṛśaḥ eva buddhi nirmitaḥ maraṇa kāla samaye puratas sthāsyati
translated: for them, that Tathāgata Amitābha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, with the same color, form, height, and girth, and surrounded by a community of monks, will appear in the same way, a Buddha-created emanation, in front of them at the time of death.

original: te tenaiva tathāgatadarśanaprasādālambanena samādhinā apramuṣitayā smṛtyā cyutāstatraiva buddhakṣetre pratyājaniṣyanti // //
analyzed: te tena eva tathāgata darśana prasāda ālambanena samādhinā apramuṣitayā smṛtyā cyutāḥ tatra eva buddhakṣetre pratyājaniṣyanti  /
translated: By means of that very samādhi, which is the basis for the faith and vision of that Tathāgata, and with undiminished mindfulness, they will pass away and be reborn in that very Buddha-field.

analyzed: ye punar ānanda sattvāḥ tam tathāgatam daśa citta utpādāt samanusmariṣyanti
translated: And again, Ānanda, those beings who will recollect that Tathāgata for ten moments of thought,

analyzed: spṛhām ca tasmin buddhakṣetre utpādayiṣyanti
translated: and will produce longing for that Buddha-field,

original: gambhīreṣu ca dharmeṣu bhāṣyamāṇeṣu tuṣṭiṃ pratilapsyante /
analyzed: gambhīreṣu ca dharmeṣu bhāṣyamāṇeṣu tuṣṭim pratilapsyante
translated: And when the profound Dharma is being taught, they will attain satisfaction.

analyzed: na vipatsyante  na viṣādam āpatsyante
translated: They will not be destroyed.🔽They will not fall into despair.

analyzed: na saṃsadanam āpatsyante
translated: They will not become discouraged.

analyzed: antaśas eka citta utpādena api tam tathāgatam manasikariṣyanti
translated: At least for one moment of thought they will pay attention to that Tathāgata.

analyzed: spṛhām ca utpādayiṣyanti tasmin buddhakṣetre
translated: And they will arouse longing for that Buddha-field.

analyzed: te pi svapna antara gatāḥ amitābham tathāgatam drakṣyanti
translated: Even when they are in dreams they will see the Tathāgata Amitābha.

analyzed: sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: They will be reborn in the world-system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: a vaivartikāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And they will become irreversible from supreme and complete Awakening.

original: imaṃ khalvānanda arthavaśaṃ saṃpaśya tathāgatā daśasu dikṣu aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāsu lokadhātuṣu tasyāmitābhasya tathāgatasya nāmagheyaṃ parikīrtayanto varṇaṃ ghoṣayantaḥ saṃpraśaṃsāmabhyudīrayanti /
