analyzed: sarve te dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa samanvāgatāḥ paripūrṇa gātrāḥ dhyāna abhijñā kovidāḥ prajñā prabheda kuśalāḥ tīkṣṇa indriyāḥ su saṃvṛta indriyāḥ ājñāta avindriyāḥ adīna abala indriyāḥ pratilambha kṣāntikāḥ ananta aparyanta guṇāḥ  /
translated: are endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being, have perfect bodies, are skilled in the meditative absorptions and superknowledges, are skilled in discerning wisdom, have sharp faculties, well-controlled faculties, faculties that are invincible, faculties that are not discouraged, and have infinite and boundless qualities.

original: tasmin khalu punarānanda buddhakṣetre ye bodhisattvā pratyājātāḥ /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar ānanda buddhakṣetre ye bodhisattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ
translated: Ānanda, in that buddha realm, all the bodhisattvas who are reborn

analyzed: sarve buddha darśanena avinipāta dharmāṇaḥ yāvat bodhi paryantam
translated: are never separated from seeing the Buddha, are not subject to falling back, and will continue until they reach enlightenment.

original: sarve te tata upādāya na jātu jātismarā bhaviṣyanti sthāpayitvā tathārūpeṣu kalpasaṃkṣobheṣu ye pūrvasthānapraṇihitāḥ pañcasu kaṣāyeṣu vartamāneṣu yadā buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati tadyathāpi nāma mamaitarhi // //
analyzed: sarve te tatas upādāya na jātu jātismarāḥ bhaviṣyanti sthāpayitvā tathārūpeṣu kalpa saṃkṣobheṣu ye pūrva sthāna praṇihitāḥ pañcasu kaṣāyeṣu vartamāneṣu yadā buddhānām bhagavatām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati tat yathā api nāma mama etarhi
translated: From that time onward, they will never forget their births, except in world systems that are destroyed in the five ways, when they are reborn in the five corruptions, when the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, appear in the world, just as they do for me now.

original: tasmin khalu punarānanda buddhakṣetre ye bodhisattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar ānanda buddhakṣetre ye bodhisattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ
translated: In that buddha-field, Ānanda, all the bodhisattvas who are reborn

original: sarve te ekapurobhaktenānyāllokadhātūn gatvā anekāni buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyupatiṣṭhanti yāvadākāṅkṣanti buddhānubhāvena /
analyzed: sarve te eka purobhaktena anyān lokadhātūn gatvā anekāni buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi upatiṣṭhanti yāvat ākāṅkṣanti buddha anubhāvena
translated: go to other world systems in one morning meal and serve many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas as much as they wish, by the power of the Buddha.

original: te yathā yathā cittamutpādayanti evamevaṃrūpaiḥ puṣpadhūpadīpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantītūryasaṃgītivādyaiḥ pūjāṃ kuryāma iti /
analyzed: te yathā yathā cittam utpādayanti evam evaṃrūpaiḥ puṣpa dhūpa dīpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantī tūrya saṃgīti vādyaiḥ pūjām kuryāmaḥ iti
translated: And as soon as they arouse the thought, 'In this way we will make offerings with flowers, incense, lamps, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, music, song and dance,'

original: teṣāṃ sahacittotpādāttathārūpāṇi ca sarvapūjāvidhānāni pāṇau prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: teṣām saha citta utpādāt tathārūpāṇi ca sarva pūjā vidhānāni pāṇau prādurbhavanti
translated: those very same offerings appear in their hands.

original: te taiḥ puṣpairyāvadvādyaisteṣu buddheṣu bhagavatsu pūjāṃ kurvanto bahvaparimāṇāsaṃkhyeyaṃ kuśalamupacinvanti /
analyzed: te taiḥ puṣpaiḥ yāvat vādyaiḥ teṣu buddheṣu bhagavatsu pūjām kurvantaḥ bahu aparimāṇa asaṃkhyeyam kuśalam upacinvanti
translated: And with those flowers up to the music, they make offerings to those Blessed Buddhas and accumulate immeasurable, incalculable merit.

analyzed: saced punar ākāṅkṣanti evaṃrūpāḥ puṣpa puṭāḥ pāṇau prādurbhavantu iti
translated: If they wish, 'May flower baskets appear in our hands,'

original: teṣāṃ sahacittotpādānnānāvarṇā anekavarṇā nānāgandhā divyāḥ puṣpapuṭāḥ pāṇau prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: teṣām saha citta utpādāt nānā varṇāḥ aneka varṇāḥ nānā gandhāḥ divyāḥ puṣpa puṭāḥ pāṇau prādurbhavanti
translated: As soon as they think of it, various divine flowers of many colors and fragrances appear in their hands.

original: te taistathārūpaiḥ puṣpapuṭaistān buddhān bhagavato'vakiranti abhyavakiranti abhiprakiranti /
analyzed: te taiḥ tathārūpaiḥ puṣpa puṭaiḥ tān buddhān bhagavataḥ uvakiranti abhyavakiranti abhiprakiranti
translated: They scatter those flowers of various kinds on the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and sprinkle them.

original: teṣāṃ ca yaḥ sarvaparītaḥ puṣpapuṭa utsṛṣṭaḥ sa daśayojanavistaraṃ puṣpacchatraṃ prādurbhavati uparyantarīkṣe /
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ sarva parītaḥ puṣpa puṭaḥ utsṛṣṭaḥ sa daśa yojana vistaram puṣpa chatram prādurbhavati upari antarīkṣe
translated: The smallest handful of flowers that is released by them becomes a flower parasol ten yojanas in diameter in the sky above.

original: dvitīye cānutsṛṣṭe na prathamo dharaṇyāṃ prapatati /
analyzed: dvitīye ca an utsṛṣṭe na prathamaḥ dharaṇyām prapatati
translated: And when the second is released, the first does not fall to the ground.

original: santi tatra puṣpapuṭā ya utsṛṣṭāḥ santo viṃśatiyojanavistārāṇi puṣpacchatrāṇyuparyantarīkṣe prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: santi tatra puṣpa puṭāḥ ye utsṛṣṭāḥ santaḥ viṃśati yojana vistārāṇi puṣpa chatrāṇi upari antarīkṣe prādurbhavanti
translated: There are some handfuls of flowers that, when released, become flower parasols in the sky above, twenty yojanas in diameter.

analyzed: santi triṃśat catvāriṃśat pañcāśat yojana vistārāṇi
translated: There are some thirty, forty, and fifty yojanas in diameter.

analyzed: santi yāvat yojana śata sahasra vistārāṇi puṣpa chatrāṇi upari antarīkṣe prādurbhavanti
translated: There are some up to one hundred thousand yojanas in diameter that become flower parasols in the sky above.

analyzed: tatra ye udāram prīti prāmodyam saṃjanayanti
translated: Among them, those who generate vast joy and delight

analyzed: udāram ca citta audvilyam pratilabhante
translated: and obtain vast mental elation

original: te bahvaparimitamasaṃkhyeyaṃ kuśalamūlamavaropya bahūni ca buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyupasthāya ekapūrvāhṇena punarapi sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau pratiṣṭhante tasyaivāmitāyuṣastathāgatasya pūrvapraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānaparigraheṇa pūrvadattadharmaśravaṇena pūrvajināvaropitakuśalamūlatayā pūrvapraṇidhānasamṛddhiparipūryātmabhūtayā suvibhaktabhāvitayā // //
analyzed: te bahu aparimitam asaṃkhyeyam kuśala mūlam avaropya bahūni ca buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi upasthāya eka pūrvāhṇena punar api sukhāvatyām lokadhātau pratiṣṭhante tasya eva amitāyuṣaḥ tathāgatasya pūrva praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhāna parigraheṇa pūrva datta dharma śravaṇena pūrva jina avaropita kuśala mūla tayā pūrva praṇidhāna samṛddhi paripūrya ātma bhūtayā su vibhakta bhāvitayā  /
translated: Having planted many, innumerable, incalculable roots of virtue, having served many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Buddhas, they will again, in one morning, be established in the world system Sukhāvatī, by the power of the previous vows of that Tathāgata Amitāyus, by the previous hearing of the Dharma, by the previous planting of roots of virtue under the Jinas, by the previous accomplishment and fulfillment of vows, by the previous well-distinguished and cultivated [practice].

original: tasmin khalu punarānanda buddhakṣetre ye sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar ānanda buddhakṣetre ye sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ
translated: In that Buddha-field, Ānanda, all the beings who are reborn

analyzed: sarve te sarvajña tā sahagatām eva dharma kathām kathayanti
translated: all speak Dharma discourses that are connected with omniscience.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānāṃ kācitparigrahasaṃjñāsti /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānām kācid parigraha saṃjñā asti
translated: And in that Buddha-field, the beings have no notion of possession at all.

original: te sarve ca tadbuddhakṣetramanucaṃkramamāṇā anuvicaranto na ratiṃ nāratimutpādayanti /
analyzed: te sarve ca tat buddhakṣetram anucaṃkramamāṇāḥ anuvicarantaḥ na ratim na aratim utpādayanti
translated: All of them, wandering and roaming through that Buddha-field, do not arouse pleasure or displeasure.

analyzed: prakrāmantaḥ ca anapekṣāḥ
translated: They go forth without attachment.

analyzed: na ca prakrāmanti sa apekṣāḥ
translated: They do not go forth with attachment.

analyzed: sarva sattveṣām eva cittam na asti
translated: And they have no thought of all beings at all.

original: tatra khalu punarānanda sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau ye sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ /🔽nāsti teṣāmanyatamakasaṃjñā /🔽nāsti svakasaṃjñā /
analyzed: tatra khalu punar ānanda sukhāvatyām lokadhātau ye sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ  na asti teṣām anyatamaka saṃjñā  na asti svaka saṃjñā
translated: And there, Ānanda, in the Sukhāvatī world-system, the beings who are reborn there,🔽they have no notion of 'other'.🔽They have no notion of 'mine'.

analyzed: na asti asamasaṃjñā  na asti vigrahaḥ
translated: They have no notion of 'not equal'.🔽There is no quarreling.

analyzed: na asti vivādaḥ
translated: There is no dispute.

analyzed: na asti virodhaḥ
translated: There is no conflict.

original: samacittā maitracittā mṛducittāḥ snigdhacittāḥ karmaṇyacittāḥ prasannacittāḥ sthiracittā vinīvaraṇacittā akṣubhitacittā alulitacittāḥ prajñāpāramitācaryācaraṇacittāścittādhārabuddhipraviṣṭāḥ
analyzed: sama cittāḥ maitra cittāḥ mṛdu cittāḥ snigdha cittāḥ karmaṇya cittāḥ prasanna cittāḥ sthira cittāḥ vinīvaraṇa cittāḥ a kṣubhita cittāḥ a lulita cittāḥ prajñāpāramitā caryā caraṇa cittāḥ citta ādhāra buddhi praviṣṭāḥ
translated: They have minds of equality, friendly minds, gentle minds, affectionate minds, workable minds, clear minds, firm minds, unhindered minds, imperturbable minds, unagitated minds, minds engaged in the practice of the perfection of wisdom, minds entered into the foundation of mind,

analyzed: sāgara samāḥ prajñayā
translated: equal to the ocean in wisdom,

analyzed: meru samāḥ buddhyā
translated: like Mount Meru in intelligence,

analyzed: aneka guṇa saṃnicayāḥ  bodhyaṅga saṃgītyā vikrīḍitāḥ
translated: accumulations of many qualities,🔽playing with the recitation of the factors of enlightenment,

analyzed: buddha saṃgīti abhiyuktāḥ māṃsa cakṣuḥ pravicinvanti
translated: devoted to the recitation of the Buddha, discerning with the fleshly eye,

analyzed: divyam cakṣuḥ abhinirharanti
translated: manifesting the divine eye,

original: prajñācakṣurgatiṃgatā dharmacakṣuḥpāragatā buddhacakṣurniṣpādayanto darśayanto dyotayanto vistareṇa prakāśayanto'saṅgajñānamabhinirharanti /
analyzed: prajñācakṣuḥ gatiṃgatāḥ dharmacakṣuḥ pāragatāḥ buddha cakṣuḥ niṣpādayantaḥ darśayantaḥ dyotayantaḥ vistareṇa prakāśayantaḥ usaṅga jñānam abhinirharanti
translated: having attained the eye of wisdom, having gone beyond the eye of Dharma, accomplishing the eye of the Buddha, showing, illuminating, and extensively teaching, manifesting unobstructed knowledge.

original: traidhātukasamatāyāmabhiyuktā dāntacittāḥ śāntacittāḥ sarvadharmadhātūpalabdhisamanvāgatāḥ samudayaniruktikuśalā dharmaniruktisamanvāgatā hārāhārakuśalā nayānayakuśalāḥ sthānakuśalā laukikīṣu kathāsvanapekṣā viharanti /
analyzed: traidhātuka samatāyām abhiyuktāḥ dānta cittāḥ śānta cittāḥ sarva dharmadhātu upalabdhi samanvāgatāḥ samudaya nirukti kuśalāḥ dharma nirukti samanvāgatāḥ hāra āhāra kuśalāḥ naya anaya kuśalāḥ sthāna kuśalāḥ laukikīṣu kathāsu anapekṣāḥ viharanti
translated: They are devoted to the equality of the three realms. They have controlled minds, peaceful minds, and are endowed with the attainment of the entire realm of phenomena. They are skilled in the etymology of origination and skilled in the etymology of phenomena. They are skilled in what is to be adopted and what is to be abandoned, skilled in what is proper and improper, and skilled in proper conduct. They live without concern for worldly talk.

analyzed: lokottarābhiḥ kathābhiḥ sāram pratyayanti
translated: They take interest in the essence of supramundane talk.

original: sarvadharmaparyeṣṭikuśalāḥ sarvadharmaprakṛtivyupaśamajñānavihāriṇo'nupalambhagocarā niṣkiṃcanā nirupādānā niścintā nirupadhayo'nupādāya suvimuktā anaṅgaṇā aparyasthāyino'bhijñāsu amūlasthāyino'saṅgācārikā anavalīnā gambhīreṣu dharmeṣvabhiyuktā na saṃsīdanti dūranubodhabuddhajñānapraveśodgatā ekāyanamārgānuprāptā nirvicikitsāstīrṇakathaṃkathā aparapratyayajñānā anadhimāninaḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma paryeṣṭi kuśalāḥ sarva dharma prakṛti vyupaśama jñāna vihāriṇaḥ anupalambha gocarāḥ niṣkiṃcanāḥ nirupādānāḥ niścintāḥ nirupadhayaḥ nupādāya su vimuktāḥ anaṅgaṇāḥ a paryasthāyinaḥ abhijñāsu a mūla sthāyinaḥ usaṅga ācārikāḥ anavalīnāḥ gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu abhiyuktāḥ na saṃsīdanti dūranubodha buddha jñāna praveśa udgatāḥ ekāyana mārga anuprāptāḥ niḥ vicikitsā āstīrṇa kathaṃkathāḥ apara pratya
translated: They are skilled in seeking all phenomena. They dwell in the knowledge of the natural peace of all phenomena. Their domain is non-apprehension. They are without possessions, without clinging, without worry, without attachments, well-liberated without clinging, without defilements, without abiding, skilled in the superknowledges, without abiding in roots, without clinging in conduct, without laziness, devoted to the profound teachings without sinking, arisen from entering the knowledge of the Buddha, which is to be realized after a long time, attained the path of the single way, without doubt, with talk and discussion put aside, with knowledge not dependent on others, without conceit.

analyzed: sumeru samāḥ jñāna abhyudgatāḥ 🔽sāgara samāḥ buddhi akṣobhyāḥ
translated: They are exalted in knowledge like Mount Sumeru.🔽They are unshakable in wisdom like the ocean.

analyzed: candra sūrya prabhā atikrāntāḥ prajñā ābhayā pāṇḍara su śukla śuddha śubha citta tayā ca
translated: They surpass the light of the sun and moon with their pure, bright, immaculate, and beautiful mind.

analyzed: uttapta hema varṇa sadṛśāḥ avabhāsa nirbhāsa tayā ca
translated: They are like refined gold in color with their radiance and illumination.

analyzed: vasuṃdharā sadṛśāḥ sarva sattva śubha aśubha kṣamaṇa tayā  ap sadṛśāḥ sarva kleśa mūla nirdhāvana pravāhaṇa tayā ca
translated: They are like the earth in enduring the good and bad of all beings.🔽They are like water in washing away the roots of all afflictions.

analyzed: agnirāja sadṛśāḥ sarva dharma manyanā kleśa nirdahana tayā
translated: They are like a blazing fire in burning up the afflictions of conceit towards all phenomena.

analyzed: vāyu sadṛśāḥ sarva loka asañjana tayā
translated: They are like the wind in not clinging to any world.

analyzed: ākāśa sadṛśāḥ sarva dharma nairvedhika tayā sarvaśas niṣkiṃcana tayā ca
translated: They are like space in penetrating all phenomena and being completely devoid of anything.

analyzed: padma sadṛśāḥ sarva loka an upalipta tayā  kāla anusāri mahā megha sadṛśāḥ dharma abhigarjana tayā
translated: They are like lotuses in being unstained by any world.🔽They are like the great cloud that follows the seasons in thundering the Dharma.

analyzed: mahā vṛṣṭi sadṛśāḥ dharma salila abhipravarṣaṇa tayā
translated: They are like a great rain in showering down the water of the Dharma.

analyzed: ṛṣabha sadṛśāḥ mahā gaṇa abhibhavana tayā
translated: They are like a bull in overpowering the great assemblies.

analyzed: mahā nāga sadṛśāḥ parama su dānta citta tayā  bhadrāśva ājāneya sadṛśāḥ su vinīta tayā
translated: They are like great elephants in having a supremely well-tamed mind.🔽They are like a well-trained noble horse.

analyzed: siṃha mṛgarāja sadṛśāḥ vikrama vaiśāradya asaṃtrasta tayā
translated: They are like a lion, the king of beasts, in being fearless and courageous.

analyzed: nyagrodha drumarāja sadṛśāḥ sarva sattva paritrāṇa tayā
translated: They are like the king of trees, the banyan, because they protect all beings.

analyzed: parvatarāja sadṛśāḥ sarva para pravādya kampana tayā
translated: They are like the king of mountains because they cannot be shaken by any opponent.

analyzed: gagana sadṛśāḥ aparimāṇa maitrī prabhāvana tayā
translated: They are like the sky because they manifest immeasurable friendliness.

analyzed: mahābrahma samāḥ sarva kuśala mūla dharma ādhipatya pūrvaṃgama tayā
translated: They are like the great Brahma because they are at the head of all wholesome roots and dharmas.

analyzed: pakṣi sadṛśāḥ a saṃnicaya sthāna tayā
translated: They are like birds because they do not accumulate.

analyzed: garuḍa dvijarāja sadṛśāḥ sarva para pravādi vidhvaṃsana tayā
translated: They are like the king of birds, Garuda, because they destroy all opponents.

analyzed: udumbara puṣpa sadṛśā durlabha a pratyarthi tayā
translated: They are like the udumbara flower because they are rarely sought after.

analyzed: nāga vat su samāhitā avikṣipta a jihma indriya tayā
translated: Like elephants, they are well-concentrated, with undistracted faculties.

analyzed: viniścaya kuśalāḥ kṣānti saurabhya bahulāḥ
translated: They are skilled in discernment, with much patience and gentleness.

analyzed: anīrṣukāḥ para saṃpatti a prārthana tayā  viśāradā dharma kathā sva tṛptā dharma paryeṣṭayā
translated: They are without envy because they do not desire the prosperity of others.🔽They are fearless because they are satisfied with the Dharma and seek the Dharma.

analyzed: vaiḍūrya sadṛśāḥ śīlena  ratna ākarāḥ śrutena
translated: They are like lapis lazuli because of their morality.🔽They are like a mine of jewels because of their learning.

analyzed: mañju svarāḥ mahā dharma dundubhi nirghoṣeṇa
translated: They have a sweet voice because of the great sound of the Dharma drum.

original: mahādharmabherīṃ parāghnanto mahādharmaśaṅkhamāpūrayanto mahādharmadhvajamucchrāpayanto dharmolkāṃ prajvālayantaḥ prajñāvilokino'saṃmūḍhā nirdoṣāḥ śāntakhilāḥ śuddhā nirāmagandhā alubdhāḥ saṃvibhāgaratā muktatyāgāḥ prasṛtapāṇayo dānasaṃvibhāgaratā dharmāmiṣābhyāṃ dāne'matsariṇo'saṃsṛṣṭā urtrastamānasā viraktā dhīrā dhaureyā dhṛtimanto hrīmantaḥ suvyūḍhasattvā nirgāḍhāḥ prāptābhijñāḥ suratāḥ sukhasaṃvāsā arthakarā lokapradyotā nāpadāgantuṃ dhīrā rāgaṃ tamaḥ pranekasvaṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: mahā dharma bherīm parāghnantaḥ mahā dharma śaṅkham āpūrayantaḥ mahā dharma dhvajam ucchrāpayantaḥ dharma ulkām prajvālayantaḥ prajñā vilokinaḥ usaṃmūḍhāḥ nirdoṣāḥ śānta khilāḥ śuddhāḥ niḥ āma gandhāḥ alubdhāḥ saṃvibhāga ratāḥ mukta tyāgāḥ prasṛta pāṇayaḥ dāna saṃvibhāga ratāḥ dharma āmiṣābhyām dāne matsariṇaḥ saṃsṛṣṭāḥ urtrasta mānasāḥ viraktāḥ dhīrāḥ dhaureyāḥ dhṛtimantaḥ hrīmantaḥ su
translated: They were beating the great drum of the Dharma, blowing the great conch of the Dharma, raising the great banner of the Dharma, lighting the torch of the Dharma, endowed with wisdom, undeluded, faultless, peaceful, pure, free from defilements, unattached, delighting in sharing, generous, open-handed, delighting in giving and sharing, not stingy with their possessions, not clinging, fearless in mind, detached, courageous, steadfast, resolute, modest, of firm resolve, deeply committed, attained higher knowledge, delightful to be with, easy to live with, benefactors, illuminators of the world, unshakable, courageous, dispelling the darkness of passion, the many kinds of self-harm,

original: śokāpagatā nirmalā nimeṣaprahīṇā vikrīḍitābhijñā hetubalikāḥ praṇidhānabalikā ajihmā akuṭilā ete lakṣakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāvaropitakuśalamūlā utpāṭitamānaśalyā apagatarāgadveṣamohāḥ śuddhāḥ śuddhādhimuktā jinabalapraśastā lokapaṇḍitā uttaptajñānasamudāgatā jinasutāścittaudbilyasamanvāgatāḥ śūrā dṛḍhā amamā akhilā atulā arajaskāḥ sahitā udārā ṛṣabhā hrīmanto dhṛtimantaḥ smṛtimanto matimanto gatimantaḥ prajñāśastrapraharaṇā puṇyavanto dyutimanto vyapagatakhilā malaprahīṇāḥ smṛtiyuktāḥ śāntajñānālambhāḥ /
analyzed: śoka apagatāḥ nirmalāḥ nimeṣa prahīṇāḥ vikrīḍita abhijñāḥ hetu balikāḥ praṇidhāna balikāḥ a jihmāḥ a kuṭilāḥ ete lakṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ utpāṭita māna śalyāḥ apagata rāga dveṣa mohāḥ śuddhāḥ śuddha adhimuktāḥ jina bala praśastāḥ loka paṇḍitāḥ uttapta jñāna samudāgatāḥ jina sutāḥ citta audbilya samanvāgatāḥ śūrāḥ dṛḍhāḥ amamāḥ akhilāḥ atulāḥ arajaskāḥ sahitā
translated: They were free from sorrow, stainless, free from blinking, playful, endowed with higher knowledge, powerful in cause, powerful in aspiration, not crooked, not deceitful, with roots of virtue planted for many hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, with the darts of pride uprooted, free from attachment, hatred, and delusion, pure, with pure aspirations, praised by the Victorious Ones, worldly experts, with knowledge arisen from intense practice, the Victorious One's sons, endowed with mental joy, heroes, firm, without possessions, without rivals, without dust, united, noble, bulls, with a sense of shame, steadfast, mindful, intelligent, with good behavior, armed with the weapon of wisdom, virtuous, radiant, free from all impurities, free from defilements, endowed with mindfulness, with the attainment of peaceful knowledge.

original: īdṛśā ānanda tasmin buddhakṣetre sattvāḥ saṃkṣiptena ca /
analyzed: īdṛśāḥ ānanda tasmin buddhakṣetre sattvāḥ saṃkṣiptena ca
translated: Such were the beings in that Buddha-field, Ananda, in brief.

analyzed: vistareṇa punar saced kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra sthitikena api āyuṣpramāṇena tathāgatāḥ nirdiśyeran
translated: If the lifespans of the Tathagatas were described for many hundreds of thousands of millions of eons,

analyzed: na eva śakyam teṣām sat puruṣāṇām guṇa paryantam adhigantum
translated: It is not possible to comprehend the limit of the qualities of those good men.

analyzed: na ca tathāgatasya vaiśāradya upacchedaḥ bhavet
translated: And there would be no interruption to the fearlessness of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ubhayamapyeva ānanda acintyamatulyaṃ yadidaṃ teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ guṇāstathāgatasya cānuttaraprajñāpratibhānam // //
analyzed: ubhayam api eva ānanda acintyam atulyam yat idam teṣām bodhisattvānām guṇāḥ tathāgatasya ca anuttara prajñā pratibhānam
translated: Both of these, Ānanda, are inconceivable and incomparable, namely, the qualities of those bodhisattvas and the unsurpassed wisdom and eloquence of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: api ca ānandaḥ uttiṣṭha
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, rise up.

analyzed: paścāt mukhībhūtvā puṣpa avakīrṇa añjalīm pragṛhya praṇipata
translated: Turn your face towards the west, take up a handful of flowers, and bow down.

original: eṣā sā dig yatra sa bhagavānamitābhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: eṣā sā diś yatra sa bhagavān amitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: That is the direction where the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha resides, is steadfast, and lives,

original: dharmaṃ ca deśayati virajo viśuddhaṃ yasya tannāmadheyamanāvaraṇe daśadiśi loke vighuṣṭam ekaikasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukāsamā buddhā bhagavanto varṇayanti stuvanti praśaṃsantyasakṛdasakṛdasaṅgavācāprativākyāḥ /
analyzed: dharmam ca deśayati virajaḥ viśuddham yasya tat nāmadheyam anāvaraṇe daśa diśi loke vighuṣṭam ekaikasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ varṇayanti stuvanti praśaṃsanti asakṛt asakṛt asaṅga vācā prativākyāḥ
translated: and teaches the Dharma that is dust-free and pure, whose name is renowned without obstruction in the ten directions of the world, and the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in each direction, repeatedly praise, extol, and commend him with unobstructed speech and replies.

original: evamukte āyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocaticchāmyahaṃ bhagavaṃstamamitābhamamitaprabhamamitāyuṣaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ draṣṭum /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat icchāmi aham bhagavan tam amitābham amitaprabham amitāyuṣam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham draṣṭum
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: I wish to see that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha, of infinite light and infinite life,

analyzed: tān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bahu buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasra avaropita kuśala mūlān
translated: and those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have planted roots of merit under many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas.

analyzed: samanantara bhāṣitā āyuṣmatā ānandena iyam vāc
translated: Immediately after this speech was spoken by the Venerable Ānanda,

original: atha tāvadeva so'mitābhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ svapāṇitalāttathārūpaṃ raśmiṃ prāmuñcadyadidaṃ koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ mahatāvabhāsena sphuṭamabhūt /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva somitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sva pāṇi talāt tathārūpam raśmim prāmuñcat yat idam koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamam buddhakṣetram mahatā avabhāsena sphuṭam abhūt
translated: then at that very moment, that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha emitted a ray of light from the palm of his hand, by which this Buddha-field of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis became filled with a great radiance.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena sarvatra koṭīśatasahasrabuddhakṣetrāṇāṃ ye kecitkālaparvatā vā ratnaparvatā vā merumahāmerumucilindamahāmucilindacakravālamahācakravālā vā citayo vā stambhā vā vṛkṣagahanodyānavimānāni divyamanuṣyakāṇi /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sarvatra koṭī śata sahasra buddhakṣetrāṇām ye kecid kāla parvatāḥ vā ratna parvatāḥ vā meru mahāmeru mucilinda mahāmucilinda cakravāla mahā cakravālāḥ vā citayaḥ vā stambhāḥ vā vṛkṣa gahana udyāna vimānāni divya manuṣyakāṇi
translated: At that time, in all those hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Buddha-fields, whatever were the black mountains, or jewel mountains, or Meru, or Mahāmeru, or Mucilinda, or Mahāmucilinda, or Cakravāla, or Mahācakravāḍa, or the earth, or the pillars, or the trees, or the thickets, or the gardens, or the celestial and human palaces,

original: tāni sarvāṇi tasya tathāgatasya tayā prabhayābhinirbhinnānyabhūvan samabhibhūtāni /
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi tasya tathāgatasya tayā prabhayā abhinirbhinnāni abhūvan samabhibhūtāni
translated: All of them were illuminated and outshone by the light of that Tathāgata.

original: tadyathāpi nāma puruṣo vyāmamātrake'nvito dvitīyaṃ puruṣaṃ pratyavekṣedāditye'bhyudgate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma puruṣaḥ vyāma mātraka invitaḥ dvitīyam puruṣam pratyavekṣet ādityebhyaḥ udgate
translated: Just as a person standing one fathom away might examine a second person at sunrise,

original: evamevāsmin buddhakṣetre bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikādevanāgayakṣarākṣasagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyāśca tasyāṃ velāyāmadrākṣustamamitābhaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ sumerumiva parvatarājaṃ sarvakṣetrābhyudgataṃ sarvā diśo'bhibhūya bhāsamānaṃ tapantaṃ virocamānaṃ vibhrājamānam /
analyzed: evam eva asmin buddhakṣetre bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā deva nāga yakṣa rākṣasa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ ca tasyām velāyām adrākṣuḥ tam amitābham tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham sumerum iva parvata rājam sarva kṣetra abhyudgatam sarvāḥ diśaḥ abhibhūya bhāsamānam tapantam virocamānam vibhrājamānam
translated: in the same way, at that time, the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans in that buddha-field saw the Tathāgata Amitābha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, like Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, rising above all fields, shining, blazing, and illuminating all directions, outshining them all.

original: taṃ ca mahāntaṃ bodhisattvagaṇaṃ taṃ ca bhikṣusaṃghaṃ yadidaṃ buddhānubhāvena tasyāḥ prabhāyāḥ pariśuddhatvāt /
analyzed: tam ca mahāntam bodhisattva gaṇam tam ca bhikṣu saṃgham yat idam buddha anubhāvena tasyāḥ prabhāyāḥ pariśuddha tvāt
translated: And that great assembly of bodhisattvas and that assembly of monks, by the power of the Buddha and the purity of that light.

analyzed: tat yathā iyam mahā pṛthivī eka udaka jātā bhavet
translated: Just as this great earth would become one great ocean,

original: tatra na vṛkṣā na parvatā na dvīpā na tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayo na nadīśvabhraprapātāḥ prajñāpayeran /
analyzed: tatra na vṛkṣāḥ na parvatāḥ na dvīpāḥ na tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ na nadī śvabhra prapātāḥ prajñāpayeran
translated: There, no trees, no mountains, no islands, no grass, shrubs, herbs, or forests, no rivers, ravines, or cliffs would be known.

analyzed: anyatra ekārṇavībhūtā mahā pṛthivī ekā syāt
translated: Except for the great earth becoming one vast ocean.

original: evameva tasmin buddhakṣetre nāstyanyatkiṃcilliṅgaṃ vā nimittaṃ vā anyatraiva vyāmaprabhāḥ śrāvakāste ca yojanakoṭīśatasahasraprabhā bodhisattvāḥ
analyzed: evam eva tasmin buddhakṣetre na asti anyat kiṃcid liṅgam vā nimittam vā anyatra eva vyāma prabhāḥ śrāvakāḥ te ca yojana koṭī śata sahasra prabhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ
translated: In the same way, in that Buddha-field, there is no other sign or indication except the light of the Bodhisattvas, which is a hundred thousand leagues in extent.

original: sa ca bhagavānamitābhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastaṃ ca śrāvakagaṇaṃ taṃ ca bodhisattvagaṇamabhibhūya sarvā diśaḥ prabhāsayan saṃdṛśyate
analyzed: sa ca bhagavān amitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tam ca śrāvaka gaṇam tam ca bodhisattva gaṇam abhibhūya sarvāḥ diśaḥ prabhāsayan saṃdṛśyate
translated: And that Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Amitabha, outshining that assembly of disciples and that assembly of Bodhisattvas, is seen illuminating all directions.

original: tena khalvapi samayena tasyāṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau bodhisattvāḥ śrāvakadevamanuṣyāśca sarve te imāḥ sahālokadhātuṃ śākyamuniṃ ca tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhamarhatā bhikṣusaṃghena parivṛtaṃ paśyanti sma dharmaṃ deśayantam // //
analyzed: tena khalu api samayena tasyām sukhāvatyām lokadhātau bodhisattvāḥ śrāvaka deva manuṣyāḥ ca sarve te imāḥ sahā lokadhātum śākyamunim ca tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham arhatā bhikṣu saṃghena parivṛtam paśyanti sma dharmam deśayantam  /
translated: At that time, in that world of Sukhavati, all the Bodhisattvas, disciples, gods, and humans saw this Sahalokadhatu and the Tathagata Shakyamuni, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, surrounded by the assembly of monks, teaching the Dharma.

original: tatra khalu bhagavānajitaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayate smapaśyasi tvamajita amuṣmina buddhakṣetre guṇālaṃkāravyūhasaṃpadam /
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān ajitam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayate sma paśyasi tvam ajita amuṣmin buddhakṣetre guṇa alaṃkāra vyūha saṃpadam
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ajita: Ajita, do you see the array of qualities and ornaments in this buddha-field?🔽

analyzed: upariṣṭāt ca antarīkṣe ārāma ramaṇīyāni udyāna ramaṇīyāni nadī puṣkariṇī ramaṇīyāni nānā ratna padma utpala kumuda puṇḍarīka ākīrṇāni
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ajita, saying, Ajita, do you see the perfection of the array of qualities in this Buddha-field above, and in the sky below, the delightful parks, the delightful gardens, the delightful rivers and lotus ponds, strewn with various jewels, lotuses, blue lotuses, night lotuses, and white lotuses,

original: adhastācca dharaṇītalamupādāya yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanādgaganatalaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇaṃ puṣpāvalisamupaśobhitaṃ nānāratnastambapaṅktiparisphuṭaṃ tathāgatābhinirmitanānādvijasaṃghaniṣevitam /
analyzed: adhastāt ca dharaṇī talam upādāya yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavanāt gagana talam puṣpa abhikīrṇam puṣpa āvali samupaśobhitam nānā ratna stamba paṅkti parisphuṭam tathāgata abhinirmita nānā dvija saṃgha niṣevitam
translated: and below, from the surface of the earth up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, the sky strewn with flowers, adorned with garlands of flowers, filled with rows of various jeweled trees, frequented by various flocks of birds created by the Tathāgata?

analyzed: ajitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: The bodhisattva Ajita said, I see it, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha paśyasi punastvamajita etānamarān dvijasaṃghān sarvabuddhakṣetraṃ buddhasvareṇābhivijñāpayantaṃ yenaite bodhisattvā nityamavirahitā
analyzed: bhagavān āha paśyasi punar tvam ajitaḥ etān amarān dvija saṃghān sarva buddhakṣetram buddha svareṇa abhivijñāpayantam yena ete bodhisattvāḥ nityam avirahitā
translated: The Blessed One said, Ajita, do you see those devas and flocks of birds announcing to the entire Buddha-field with the Buddha's voice that these bodhisattvas are always inseparable🔽from the Tathāgata's voice?

analyzed: ajitaḥ āha paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: Ajita said, I see it, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha paśyasi punastvamajita atra buddhakṣetre'mūn sattvān yojanaśatasahasrikeṣu vimāneṣvabhirūḍhānantarīkṣe sasatkārān krāmantaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha paśyasi punar tvam ajita atra buddhakṣetrā imūn sattvān yojana śata sahasrikeṣu vimāneṣu abhirūḍhān antarīkṣe sa satkārān krāmantaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Do you see, Ajita, those beings in this Buddha-field who are riding in palaces a hundred thousand leagues high, moving through space, being honored?

analyzed: ajitaḥ āha paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: Ajita said, I see them, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase ajita asti kiṃcinnānātvaṃ devānāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau manuṣyāṇāṃ vā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase ajita asti kiṃcid nānātvam devānām paranirmitavaśavartinām sukhāvatyām lokadhātau manuṣyāṇām vā
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Ajita, is there any difference between the gods who control others' emanations and the humans in the world system Sukhāvatī?

original: ajita āha ekamapyahaṃ bhagavan nānātvaṃ na samanupaśyāmi yāvanmaharddhikā atra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ /
analyzed: ajitaḥ āha ekam api aham bhagavat nānātvam na samanupaśyāmi yāvat maharddhikāḥ atra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ
translated: Ajita said, Blessed One, I do not see even the slightest difference, up to the humans in the world system Sukhāvatī being so powerful.

original: bhagavānāhapaśyasi punastvamajita tatra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāveteṣāṃ manuṣyāṇāmudāreṣu padmeṣu garbhāvāsam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha paśyasi punar tvam ajita tatra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau eteṣām manuṣyāṇām udāreṣu padmeṣu garbhāvāsam
translated: The Blessed One said, Do you see, Ajita, those humans in the world system Sukhāvatī dwelling in the wombs of the magnificent lotuses there?

original: āhatadyathāpi nāma devāstrāyastriṃśā devā yāmā vā pañcāśadyojanikeṣu vā yojanaśatikeṣu vā pañcayojanaśatikeṣu vā vimāneṣu praviṣṭāḥ krīḍanti ramanti paricārayanti /
analyzed: āha tat yathā api nāma devāḥ trāyastriṃśāḥ devāḥ yāmāḥ vā pañcāśat yojanikeṣu vā yojana śatikeṣu vā pañca yojana śatikeṣu vā vimāneṣu praviṣṭāḥ krīḍanti ramanti paricārayanti
translated: He said, It is just as if the gods of the Thirty-Three or the Yāma gods, having entered palaces of fifty leagues, a hundred leagues, or five hundred leagues, play, enjoy themselves, and amuse themselves.

original: evamevāhaṃ bhagavan atra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāveteṣāṃ manuṣyāṇāmudāreṣu padmeṣu garbhāvāsaṃ paśyāmi // //
analyzed: evam eva aham bhagavan atra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau eteṣām manuṣyāṇām udāreṣu padmeṣu garbhāvāsam paśyāmi
translated: In this way, Blessed One, I see these humans in the delightful world system of Sukhāvatī taking birth in the womb of large lotuses.”

original: santi khalu punaratra bhagavan sattvā ya aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: santi khalu punar atra bhagavan sattvāḥ ye aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: “Blessed One, there are also beings who are spontaneously born, appearing cross-legged in lotuses.

original: tatko'tra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadanye garbhāvāsaṃ prativasanti /
analyzed: tat kaḥ utra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat anye garbhāvāsam prativasanti
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, that some take birth in the womb,

analyzed: anye punar aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: while others are spontaneously born, appearing cross-legged in lotuses?”

original: bhagavānāhaye te ajita bodhisattvā anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapattaye vicikitsāmutpādayanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ye te ajita bodhisattvāḥ anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapattaye vicikitsām utpādayanti
translated: The Blessed One said, “Ajita, those bodhisattvas who are in other buddha-fields and give rise to doubt about taking birth in the world system of Sukhāvatī,

analyzed: tena cittena kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: and who plant roots of virtue with that mind,

analyzed: teṣām atra garbhāvāsaḥ bhavati
translated: they take birth in the womb there.

original: ye punarnirvicikitsāmutpādya cchinnakāṅkṣāḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapattaye kuśalamūlānyavaropayanti /
analyzed: ye punar niḥ vicikitsām utpādya chinna kāṅkṣāḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapattaye kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: But those who, having given rise to doubt, having had their doubts cut off, plant roots of virtue for taking birth in the world system of Sukhāvatī,

analyzed: buddhānām bhagavatām asaṅga jñānam eva a kalpayanti abhiśraddadhati adhimucyante
translated: and who imagine the unobstructed knowledge of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have faith in it, and aspire to it,

analyzed: te aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: They are spontaneously born, appearing on lotus flowers in full-lotus posture.

original: ye te ajita bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anyatra buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāścittamutpādayanti amitābhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya /
analyzed: ye te ajita bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ anyatra buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāḥ cittam utpādayanti amitābhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established in other buddha-fields and generate the thought to see the Tathāgata Amitābha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

analyzed: na vicikitsām utpādayanti
translated: do not give rise to doubt.

analyzed: na kāṅkṣanti asaṅgam buddha jñānam
translated: They do not have doubts about the unobstructed buddha-knowledge.

analyzed: sva kuśala mūlam ca abhiśraddadhati
translated: They have faith in their own roots of virtue.

original: teṣāmaupapādukānāṃ paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhūtānāṃ muhūrtamātreṇa evaṃrūpaḥ kāyo bhavati tadyathānyeṣāṃ ciropapannānāṃ sattvānām /
analyzed: teṣām aupapādukānām paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhūtānām muhūrta mātreṇa evaṃrūpaḥ kāyaḥ bhavati tat yathā anyeṣām cira upapannānām sattvānām
translated: For those who are spontaneously born, appearing on lotus flowers in full-lotus posture, in just a moment their bodies become like those of other beings who have been born there for a long time.

original: paśya ajita prajñāviśeṣaṃ prajñāvaimātryaṃ prajñāparihāṇiṃ prajñāparīttatāmyattu hitāya pañcavarṣaśatāni parihīṇā bhavanti buddhadarśanādbodhisattvadarśanāddharmaśravaṇāddharmasaṃkathanāt
analyzed: paśya ajita prajñā viśeṣam prajñā vaimātryam prajñā parihāṇim prajñā parītta tāmyat tu hitāya pañca varṣa śatāni parihīṇāḥ bhavanti buddha darśanāt bodhisattva darśanāt dharma śravaṇāt dharma saṃkathanāt
translated: Look, Ajita, at the difference in wisdom, the disparity in wisdom, the loss of wisdom, the smallness of wisdom - for five hundred years they are deprived of seeing the Buddha, seeing the bodhisattvas, hearing the Dharma, discussing the Dharma,

original: kuśalamūlacaryāyāḥ parihīṇā bhavanti sarvakuśalamūlasaṃpattibhiḥ yadidaṃ vicikitsāpatitaiḥ saṃjñāmanasikāraiḥ /
analyzed: kuśala mūla caryāyāḥ parihīṇāḥ bhavanti sarva kuśala mūla saṃpattibhiḥ yat idam vicikitsā patitaiḥ saṃjñā manasikāraiḥ
translated: They fall away from the practice of the roots of virtue and from all the excellences of the roots of virtue, because of their thoughts and mental activities, which are subject to doubt.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ajita rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya bandhanāgāraṃ bhavetsarvasauvarṇavaiḍūryapratyuptamavasaktapaṭṭamālyadāmakalāpaṃ nānāraṅgavibhavavitānaṃ dūṣyapaṭṭasaṃchannaṃ nānāpuṣpakusumābhikīrṇamudāradhūpanirdhūpitaṃ prāsādaharmyaniryūhagavākṣavedikātoraṇavicitraṃ saptaratnaṃ kiṅkiṇījālasaṃchannaṃ caturasraṃ catuḥsthūṇaṃ caturdvāraṃ catuḥsopānam /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ajita rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya bandhanāgāram bhavet sarva sauvarṇa vaiḍūrya pratyuptam avasakta paṭṭa mālya dāma kalāpam nānā raṅga vibhava vitānam dūṣya paṭṭa saṃchannam nānā puṣpa kusuma abhikīrṇam udāra dhūpa nirdhūpitam prāsāda harmya niryūha gavākṣa vedikā toraṇa vicitram sapta ratnam kiṅkiṇī jāla saṃchannam catur asram catur sthūṇam catur dvāram catur sopānam
translated: “Ajita, it is as follows. Suppose there were a prison of a king who has been consecrated in a royal consecration ritual, made entirely of gold and beryl, hung with silk tassels, garlands, and wreaths, with canopies of various colors, covered with calico cloth, strewn with various flowers, perfumed with superior incense, with towers, terraces, windows, balconies, and archways made of the seven precious substances, covered with nets of bells made of the seven precious substances, square with four corners, with four pillars, four doors, and four staircases.

original: tatra tasya sa rājñaḥ putraḥ kenacideva kṛtyena prakṣipya jāmbūnadasuvarṇamayairnigaḍairbaddho bhavati /
analyzed: tatra tasya sa rājñaḥ putraḥ kenacid eva kṛtyena prakṣipya jāmbūnada suvarṇa mayaiḥ nigaḍaiḥ baddhaḥ bhavati
translated: “Suppose the king’s son were thrown into that prison for some reason and were bound with shackles and chains made of the finest gold.

original: tasya ca tatra paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ syādanekagoṇikāstīrṇastūlikāparṇakāstīrṇaḥ kāliṅgaprāvaraṇapratyāstaraṇasottarapadacchada ubhayāntalohitopadhānaścitro darśanīyaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca tatra paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ syāt aneka goṇikā āstīrṇaḥ tūlikā parṇaka āstīrṇaḥ kāliṅga prāvaraṇa pratyāstaraṇa sa uttara padacchadaḥ ubhaya anta lohita upadhānaḥ citraḥ darśanīyaḥ
translated: And there a couch would be prepared for him, covered with many woolen blankets, with cotton wadding and woolen covers, with coverings of antelope skin, with a canopy above and red bolsters at both ends, colorful and beautiful.

original: sa tatra tadābhiṣaṇṇo vā abhisaṃpanno vā bhavet /
analyzed: sa tatra tadā abhiṣaṇṇaḥ vā abhisaṃpannaḥ vā bhavet
translated: And he would be lying down there, either asleep or drunk.

original: bahu cāsyānekavidhaṃ śuci vinītaṃ pānabhojanaṃ tatropanāmyeta /
analyzed: bahu ca asya anekavidham śuci vinītam pāna bhojanam tatra upanāmyeta
translated: And many kinds of pure, well-prepared drinks and foods would be presented to him there.

original: tatkiṃ manyase ajita udārastasya rājaputrasya sa paribhogo bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ajitaḥ udāraḥ tasya rāja putrasya sa paribhogaḥ bhavet
translated: What do you think, Ajita, would that prince's enjoyment be extensive?

analyzed: ajitaḥ āha audāraḥ bhagavan
translated: Ajita said, It would be extensive, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase ajita api tvāsvādayettatra niśāmayecca /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase ajita api tu āsvādayet tatra niśāmayet ca
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Ajita, would he enjoy it there and take delight in it?

analyzed: tena vā tuṣṭim vidyāt
translated: Or would he know satisfaction in that?

analyzed: āhanaḥ hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No indeed, Blessed One.

original: api tu khalu punaryadyapanītya rājñā tatra bandhanāgāre prakṣipto bhavet /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar yadi apanītya rājñā tatra bandhanāgāre prakṣiptaḥ bhavet
translated: But rather, if the king were to throw him into prison there,

analyzed: sa tatas mokṣam eva ākāṅkṣet
translated: he would only long for release from that.

original: abhijātān kumārānamātyān stryāgārān śreṣṭhino gṛhapatīn koṭṭarājāṃśca paryeṣayet /
analyzed: abhijātān kumārān amātyān stryāgārān śreṣṭhinaḥ gṛhapatīn koṭṭarājān ca paryeṣayet
translated: He would seek out the noble princes, ministers, women of the harem, chief counselors, householders, and vassal kings.

analyzed: ye enam tatas bandhanāgārāt parimocayeyuḥ
translated: Those who would liberate him from that prison

original: kiṃcāpi bhagavaṃstasya rājakumārasya tatra bandhānāgāre nābhiratiḥ /
analyzed: kiṃca api bhagavan tasya rāja kumārasya tatra bandhānāgāre na abhiratiḥ
translated: although the Blessed One, the prince would not delight in that prison,

analyzed: na atra parimucyate
translated: he would not be liberated from there.

analyzed: yāvat na rājā prasādam upadarśayati
translated: As long as the king does not show favor,

original: bhagavānāhaevameva ajita ye te bodhisattvā vicikitsāpatitāḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropayanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva ajita ye te bodhisattvāḥ vicikitsā patitāḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: the Blessed One said, Just so, Ajita, those bodhisattvas who, having fallen into doubt, plant wholesome roots,

analyzed: kāṅkṣati buddha jñānam
translated: aspire for the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: kiṃcāpi tena buddhanāmaśravaṇena tena ca cittaprasādamātreṇa atra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapadyante /
analyzed: kiṃca api tena buddha nāma śravaṇena tena ca citta prasāda mātreṇa atra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapadyante
translated: Although by hearing the name of the Buddha and by that mere faith in the mind, they are reborn in that Sukhāvatī world-system,

original: na tu khalvaupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: na tu khalu aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: but they are not spontaneously born, appearing on lotuses with their legs crossed.

analyzed: api tu padmeṣu garbhāvāsam prativasanti
translated: Rather, they dwell in the womb in the lotuses.

analyzed: kiṃca api teṣām tatra udyāna vimāna saṃjñāḥ saṃtiṣṭhante  na asti uccāra prasrāvam
translated: Although for them there are the notions of pleasure gardens and palaces,🔽there is no urine or excrement.

analyzed: na asti kheṭa siṃhāṇakam
translated: There is no nasal mucus or phlegm.

analyzed: na pratikūlam manasaḥ pravartate
translated: Nothing disagreeable occurs to the mind.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ pañca varṣaśatāni virahitā bhavanti buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena bodhisattvadarśanena dharmasāṃkathyaviniścayena sarvakuśalamūlena dharmacaryābhiśca /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar pañca varṣa śatāni virahitāḥ bhavanti buddha darśanena dharma śravaṇena bodhisattva darśanena dharma sāṃkathya viniścayena sarva kuśala mūlena dharma caryābhiḥ ca
translated: But they are separated for five hundred years from seeing a Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, from seeing a bodhisattva, from the certainty of discussion of the Dharma, and from all the roots of virtue and practices of the Dharma.

original: kiṃcāpi te tatra nābhiramante na tuṣṭiṃ vijānanti /
analyzed: kiṃca api te tatra na abhiramante na tuṣṭim vijānanti
translated: Even though they do not delight in that, they do not know satisfaction.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ pūrvāparān kṣapayitsate bhūyastataḥ paścānniskrāmanti /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar pūrva aparān kṣapayitsate bhūyas tatas paścāt niskrāmanti
translated: But after exhausting the past and future, they emerge from that.

original: na caiṣāṃ tato niṣkrāmatāṃ niṣkramaḥ prajñāyate ūrdhvamadhastiryagvā /
analyzed: na ca eṣām tatas niṣkrāmatām niṣkramaḥ prajñāyate ūrdhvam adhas tiryak vā
translated: And when they emerge from that, their emergence is not known to be upwards, downwards, or sideways.

original: paśya ajita etarhi nāma pañcabhirvarṣaśatairbahūni buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasropasthānāni syurbahvaparimāṇāsaṃkhyeyāprameyāṇi ca kuśalamūlānyavaropayitavyāni
analyzed: paśya ajitaḥ etarhi nāma pañcabhiḥ varṣa śataiḥ bahūni buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasra upasthānāni syuḥ bahu aparimāṇa asaṃkhyeya aprameyāṇi ca kuśala mūlāni avaropayitavyāni
translated: Look, Ajita! Now, after five hundred years, there will be many trillions of Buddhas to attend upon, and many immeasurable, incalculable, and innumerable roots of virtue to plant.

analyzed: tat sarvam vicikitsā doṣeṇa vināśayanti
translated: But all that is destroyed by the fault of doubt.

original: paśya ajita kiyanmahate'narthāya bodhisattvānāṃ vicikitsā saṃvartata iti /
analyzed: paśya ajita kiyat mahatena arthāya bodhisattvānām vicikitsā saṃvartate iti
translated: Look, Ajita! How great is the harm that doubt brings to bodhisattvas!

original: tasmāttarhi ajita bodhisattvairnirvicikitsairbodhaye cittamutpādya kṣipraṃ sarvasattvahitasukhādhānāya sāmarthyapratilambhārthaṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapattaye kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ajita bodhisattvaiḥ nirvicikitsaiḥ bodhaye cittam utpādya kṣipram sarva sattva hita sukha ādhānāya sāmarthya pratilambha artham sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapattaye kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: Therefore, Ajita, bodhisattvas who are free from doubt should generate the mind directed towards enlightenment and, in order to quickly attain the ability to bring about the welfare and happiness of all beings, they should dedicate their roots of virtue towards rebirth in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: yatra bhagavān amitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Where the Blessed One Amitābha, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is.

original: evamukte ajito bodhisattvo bhagavantametadavocatkiṃ punarbhagavan bodhisattvā ito buddhakṣetrātpariniṣpannā anyeṣāṃ vā buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantikātsukhāvatyāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte ajitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim punar bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ itas buddhakṣetrāt pariniṣpannāḥ anyeṣām vā buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt sukhāvatyām
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Ajita said to the Blessed One, But, Blessed One, have bodhisattvas who have completed their training here in this buddha-field or in the presence of other Blessed Buddhas been reborn in Sukhāvatī,

original: bhagavānāhaito hyajita buddhakṣetrād dvāsaptatikoṭīniyutāni bodhisattvānāṃ pariniṣpannāni yāni sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante pariniṣpannānāmavaivartikānāṃ bahubuddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyavaropitaiḥ kuśalamūlaiḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha etas hi ajita buddhakṣetrāt dvāsaptati koṭī niyutāni bodhisattvānām pariniṣpannāni yāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante pariniṣpannānām avaivartikānām bahu buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi avaropitaiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ
translated: or have they been reborn in other buddha-fields? The Blessed One said, Ajita, seventy-two koṭis of nayutas of bodhisattvas have completed their training here in this buddha-field, who will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī, of those who have completed their training and are irreversible, who have planted roots of virtue with many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of nayutas of Buddhas.

original: kaḥ punarvādastataḥ parīttataraiḥ kuśalamūlaiḥ duṣprasahasya tathāgatasyāntikādaṣṭādaśakoṭīniyutaśatāni bodhisattvānāṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ tatas parīttataraiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ duṣprasahasya tathāgatasya antikāt aṣṭādaśa koṭī niyuta śatāni bodhisattvānām sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: How much more so for those with even smaller roots of virtue! From the presence of the Tathāgata Duṣprasaha, eighteen quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: pūrvāntare digbhāge ratnākaro nāma tathāgato viharati /
analyzed: pūrva antare digbhāge ratnākaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ viharati
translated: In the eastern direction, the Tathāgata Ratnākara resides.

analyzed: tasya antikāt navati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From his presence, ninety quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: jyotiṣprabhasya tathāgatasya antikāt dvāviṃśati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante  amitaprabhasya tathāgatasya antikāt pañcaviṃśati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the presence of the Tathāgata Jyotiṣprabha, twenty-two quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.🔽From the presence of the Tathāgata Amitaprabha, twenty-five quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: lokapradīpasya tathāgatasya antikāt ṣaṣṭi bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the presence of the Tathāgata Lokapradīpa, sixty quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: nāgābhibhuvaḥ tathāgatasya antikāt catuḥṣaṣṭiḥ bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the presence of the Tathāgata Nāgābhibhū, sixty-four quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: virajaḥprabhasya tathāgatasya antikāt pañcaviṃśati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Twenty-five koṭis of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Virajaḥprabha.

analyzed: siṃhasya tathāgatasya antikāt ṣoḍaśa bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Sixteen koṭis of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Siṃha.

analyzed: siṃhasya tathāgatasya antikāt aṣṭādaśa bodhisattva sahasrāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatasyante
translated: Eighteen thousand bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Siṃha.

analyzed: śrīkūṭasya tathāgatasya antikāt ekāśīti bodhisattva koṭī niyutāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Eighty-four koṭis of niyutas of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Śrīkūṭa.

analyzed: narendra rājasya tathāgatasya antikāt daśa bodhisattva koṭī niyutāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Ten koṭis of niyutas of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Narendrāṭ.

analyzed: balābhijñasya tathāgatasya antikāt dvādaśa bodhisattva sahasrāṇi sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Twelve thousand bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Balābhijña.

original: puṣpadhvajasya tathāgatasyāntikātpañcaviṃśatirvīryaprāptā bodhisattvakoṭya ekaprasthānaprasthitā ekenāṣṭāhena navatikalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi paścānmukhīkṛtya sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante /
analyzed: puṣpadhvajasya tathāgatasya antikāt pañcaviṃśatiḥ vīrya prāptāḥ bodhisattva koṭyaḥ eka prasthāna prasthitāḥ ekena aṣṭa ahena navati kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi paścāt mukhīkṛtya sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the Tathāgata Puṣpadhvaja, twenty-five koṭis of bodhisattvas who have attained perseverance, who have set out in the one vehicle, will, in one day, turn away from ninety thousand koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of niyutas of kalpas, and will be reborn in the world system called Sukhāvatī.

original: jvalanādhipatestathāgatasyāntikāddvādaśabodhisattvakoṭyaḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante /🔽vaiśāradyaprāptasya tathāgatasyāntikādekonasaptatibodhisattvakoṭyaḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante amitābhasya tathāgatasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya paripṛcchanāya paripraśnīkaraṇāya /
analyzed: jvalanādhipateḥ tathāgatasya antikāt dvādaśa bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante  vaiśāradyaprāptasya tathāgatasya antikāt ekonasaptati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante amitābhasya tathāgatasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya paripṛcchanāya paripraśnīkaraṇāya
translated: From the Tathāgata Jvalanādhīśvara, twelve koṭis of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system called Sukhāvatī.🔽From the Tathāgata Vaiśāradyaprāpta, sixty-nine koṭis of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system called Sukhāvatī in order to see, to worship, to attend, to ask questions of, and to listen to the Tathāgata Amitābha.

original: etena ajita paryāyeṇa paripūrṇakalpakoṭīniyutaṃ nāmadheyāni parikīrtayeyaṃ teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ yebhyaste bodhisattvā upasaṃkrāmanti sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau tamamitābhaṃ tathāgataṃ draṣṭuṃ vanditu paryupāsitum /
analyzed: etena ajita paryāyeṇa paripūrṇa kalpa koṭī niyutam nāmadheyāni parikīrtayeyam teṣām tathāgatānām yebhyaḥ te bodhisattvāḥ upasaṃkrāmanti sukhāvatyām lokadhātau tam amitābham tathāgatam draṣṭum vanditu paryupāsitum
translated: By this method, Ajita, I could proclaim the names of the Tathāgatas from whom those bodhisattvas will come to the world system called Sukhāvatī in order to see, to worship, and to attend upon the Tathāgata Amitābha, for a full hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of niyutas of kalpas.

analyzed: na śakyaḥ ca paryantaḥ adhigantum
translated: And it is not possible to reach the end of them.”

original: paśya ajita kiyatsulabdhalābhāste sattvā ye'mitābhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya nāmadheyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: paśya ajita kiyat su labdha lābhāḥ te sattvāḥ yemitābhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya nāmadheyam śroṣyanti
translated: “Look, Ajita, how much gain there is for those beings who will hear the name of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha.

original: nāpi te sattvā hīnādhimuktikā bhaviṣyanti ye'ntaśaekacittaprasādamapi tasmiṃstathāgate'bhilapyante /
analyzed: na api te sattvāḥ hīna adhimuktikāḥ bhaviṣyanti tasmin tathāgata ibhilapyante
translated: Those beings will not have inferior aspirations, if they utter even one thought of faith in that Tathāgata.

analyzed: asmin ca dharmaparyāye
translated: And in this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ajitaḥ ārocayāmi vaḥ
translated: Therefore, Ajita, I declare to you,

original: prativedayāmi sadevakasya lokasya purato'sya dharmaparyāyasya śrāvaṇāya /
analyzed: prativedayāmi sa devakasya lokasya puratas asya dharmaparyāyasya śrāvaṇāya
translated: I make it known in the presence of the world with its gods, for the hearing of this Dharma discourse.

original: trisāhasramahāsāhasramapi lokadhātumagnipūrṇamavagāhya atikramaikacittotpādamapi pratisāro na kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram api lokadhātum agni pūrṇam avagāhya atikrama eka citta utpādam api pratisāraḥ na kartavyaḥ
translated: Even if one were to enter a great trichiliocosm filled with fire, one should not turn back even one thought.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: bodhisattvakoṭyo hyajita aśravaṇādeṣāmevaṃrūpāṇāṃ dharmaparyāyāṇāṃ vivartante'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattva koṭyaḥ hi ajita a śravaṇāt eṣām evaṃrūpāṇām dharmaparyāyāṇām vivartante in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Ajita, because of not hearing such Dharma discourses as these, koṭis of bodhisattvas turn back from highest genuine full Awakening.

original: tasmādasya dharmaparyāyasyādhyāśayena śravaṇodgrahaṇadhāraṇārthaṃ paryāvāptaye vistareṇa saṃprakāśāya bhāvanārthaṃ ca sumahadvīryamārabdhavyam
analyzed: tasmāt asya dharmaparyāyasya adhyāśayena śravaṇa udgrahaṇa dhāraṇa artham paryāvāptaye vistareṇa saṃprakāśāya bhāvanā artham ca su mahat vīryam ārabdhavyam
translated: Therefore, with the highest intention, in order to listen to, take up, remember, and fully understand this Dharma teaching, and in order to explain it extensively and cultivate it, one should undertake great effort.

analyzed: antaśas eka rātriṃdinam api
translated: At least for one night and day.

analyzed: eka godoha mātram api
translated: Or for the duration of a single milking of a cow.

analyzed: antaśas pustaka avaropitam kṛtvā su likhitaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: At least, having written it in a book, it should be well-written and kept.

original: śāstṛsaṃjñā ca tatropādhyāye kartavyā ya icchati kṣipramaparimitān sattvānavaivartikatve'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratiṣṭhāpayitum /
analyzed: śāstṛ saṃjñā ca tatra upādhyāye kartavyā yaḥ icchati kṣipram aparimitān sattvān avaivartika tvena uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratiṣṭhāpayitum
translated: And the teacher should be regarded as the teacher, if one wishes to quickly establish innumerable beings in irreversibility towards highest complete enlightenment.

original: tacca tasya bhagavato'mitābhasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetraṃ draṣṭum /
analyzed: tat ca tasya bhagavataḥ umitābhasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetram draṣṭum
translated: And to see that Buddha-field of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Amitābha,

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca viśiṣṭām buddhakṣetra guṇa alaṃkāra vyūha saṃpadam parigrahītum iti
translated: And to obtain for oneself the excellent perfection of the array of qualities of a Buddha-field.

original: api tu khalu ajita atyarthaṃ sulabdhalābhāste sattvā avaropitakuśalamūlāḥ pūrvajinakṛtādhikārā buddhādhiṣṭhitāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: api tu khalu ajita atyartham su labdha lābhāḥ te sattvāḥ avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ buddha dhiṣṭhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Moreover, Ajita, those beings will have gained great profit, planted the roots of virtue, made offerings to the past Victors, and will be blessed by the Buddhas.

original: yeṣāmanāgate'dhvani yāvatsaddharmavipralope vartamāne ime evaṃrūpā udārā dharmaparyāyāḥ sarvabuddhasaṃvarṇitāḥ sarvabuddhapraśastāḥ sarvabuddhānujñātā mahataḥ sarvajñajñānasya kṣipramāhārakāḥ śrotrāvabhāsamāgamiṣyanti /
analyzed: yeṣām anāgata idhvani yāvat saddharma vipralope vartamāne ime evaṃrūpāḥ udārāḥ dharmaparyāyāḥ sarva buddha saṃvarṇitāḥ sarva buddha praśastāḥ sarva buddha anujñātāḥ mahataḥ sarvajña jñānasya kṣipram āhārakāḥ śrotra avabhāsam āgamiṣyanti
translated: Those who, in the future, up to the time of the destruction of the true Dharma, when these vast Dharma discourses, praised by all Buddhas, extolled by all Buddhas, approved by all Buddhas, and quickly bringing forth the great omniscient knowledge, come within the range of hearing,

original: ye śrutvā codāraprītiprāmodyaṃ pratilapsyanta udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti parebhyo vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye śrutvā ca udāra prīti prāmodyam pratilapsyante udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti parebhyaḥ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: having heard them, will attain vast joy and delight, will accept them, retain them, recite them, master them, and explain them extensively to others.

analyzed: bhāvanā abhiratāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will delight in meditation.

analyzed: antaśas likhitvā pūjayiṣyanti

analyzed: bahu ca te puṇyam prasaviṣyanti

analyzed: yasya na sukarā saṃkhyā kartum

analyzed: yūyam idānīm abhiyujyata pratipadyadhvam

analyzed: caturviṃśatyā koṭi niyuta śata phalam prāptam

analyzed: aṣṭānām bhikṣu śatānām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni

analyzed: deva mānuṣikāyāḥ ca prajāyāḥ catvāriṃśat koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām an utpanna pūrvāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni
translated: Forty koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of gods and men, who had not previously produced the thought, produced the thought of supreme and perfect awakening.

analyzed: sarve ca te tatra upapadya anupūrveṇa mañjusvarāḥ nāma tathāgatāḥ anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu upapatsyante  aśītiḥ ca niyuta koṭyaḥ dīpaṃkare tathāgate labdha kṣāntikāḥ a vaivartikāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ amita āyuṣā eva tathāgatena paripācitāḥ pūrva bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ tāḥ ca sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapadya pūrva praṇidhāna caryāḥ paripūrayiṣyanti  /
translated: All of them, having been reborn there, will gradually attain supreme and perfect awakening, and will be reborn in other world systems as Tathāgatas named Mañjughosa.

original: tasyāṃ velāyāmayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuḥ ṣadvikāraṃ prākampat /🔽vividhāni ca prātihāryāṇi saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram prākampat 🔽vividhāni ca prātihāryāṇi saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: Eighty koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands, who had attained acceptance under the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, who were irreversible from supreme and perfect awakening, who had been matured by the Tathāgata Amitāyus while practicing the conduct of bodhisattvas in the past, will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī and will fulfill their former vows and conduct.

analyzed: pṛthivyām saṃskṛtam abhūt

analyzed: divya mānuṣyakāni ca tūryāṇi saṃpravāditāni abhūvan
translated: Divine and human musical instruments played.

analyzed: anumodanā śabdena ca yāvat akaniṣṭha bhuvanam vijñaptam abhūt  idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ
translated: And the sound of approval was heard as far as the Akaniṣṭha realm.🔽The Blessed One said this, and Ajita, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, the Venerable Ānanda, the entire assembly, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, garuḍas, and gandharvas rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

original: ajito bodhisattvo mahāsattva āyuṣmāṃścānandaḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣat sadevamānuṣāsuragaruḍagandharvasya loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandanniti bhagavato'mitābhasya tathāgatasya sukhāvatīguṇavarṇaparikīrtanaṃ bodhisattvānāmavaivartyabhūmipraveśaḥ amitābhasya parivartaḥ sukhāvatīvyūho mahāyānasūtraṃ samāptam //

translated: This concludes the description of the qualities and praises of the blessed Tathāgata Amitābha, the entry of the bodhisattvas into the stage of nonretrogression, the chapter on Amitābha, the Sūtra of the Array of the Land of Bliss, the Mahāyāna Sūtra.

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetuṃ teṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhavāḥ hetum teṣām tathāgataḥ hi avadat
translated: The Tathāgata has declared the cause for those phenomena that arise from causes.

original: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃ vādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evam vādī mahā śramaṇaḥ
translated: The great renunciant has also declared their cessation.
